main.docTitle: Merchant Shipping (Prevention of Air Pollution) Regulation

subsection.leadIn: In this Regulation—
subsection.def: Administration (主管機關), in relation to a ship, means the government of any place outside Hong Kong whose flag the ship is entitled to fly;

Annex VI (《附則VI》) means Annex VI to the Convention, entitled “Regulations for the Prevention of Air Pollution from Ships”, as from time to time revised or amended by any revision or amendment that applies to Hong Kong;

attained annual operational CII (達到的年度營運碳強度指標) means the value of the operational carbon intensity indicator of a ship determined in accordance with Regulations 26 and 28 of Annex VI; (L.N. 157 of 2022)
Attained EEDI (達到的能效設計指數) means the value of the Energy Efficiency Design Index of a ship determined in accordance with Regulation 22 of Annex VI; (L.N. 157 of 2022)
attained EEXI (現有船舶達到的能效指數) means the value of the Energy Efficiency Existing Ship Index of a ship determined in accordance with Regulation 23 of Annex VI; (L.N. 157 of 2022)

constructed (建造), in relation to a ship, means—(a)having the keel of the ship laid; or(b)being at a stage at which—(i)construction identifiable with the ship begins; and(ii)assembly of the ship has commenced comprising at least 50 tonnes or 1% of the estimated mass of all structural material, whichever is the less;
consumption data (耗油數據) means the data specified in Appendix IX to Annex VI, other than the identification data; (L.N. 21 of 2019)

Convention (《公約》) means the International Convention for the Prevention of Pollution from Ships, 1973, including its protocols and appendices, and Annex VI (but no other Annex), as from time to time revised or amended by any revision or amendment to any provision of such Convention that applies to Hong Kong;
Convention country (公約國) means a country which is a party to the Convention;
cruise passenger ship (豪華郵輪) means a cruise passenger ship as defined in Regulation 2 of Annex VI;

electronic record book (電子紀錄簿) means a device or system used for recording in electronic form the matters required to be recorded in an Ozone Depleting Substances Record Book, or in other records kept on board a ship, under this Regulation; (L.N. 122 of 2020)
existing ship (現有船舶) means a ship which is not a new ship;
fuel oil (燃油), in relation to a ship, means any fuel delivered to and intended for use on board the ship; (L.N. 105 of 2025)

def.name: FuelOilConsumptionReportingAndOperationalCarbonIntensityComplianceStatement
def.leadIn: Fuel Oil Consumption Reporting and Operational Carbon Intensity Compliance Statement (遵行規定證明(耗油報告及營運碳強度)) means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a Statement of Compliance; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: a document entitled “Statement of Compliance – Fuel Oil Consumption Reporting and Operational Carbon Intensity Rating”—

subparagraph.content: issued by a recognized organization; or

subsection.def: gas fuel (氣體燃料) has the meaning given by Regulation 2 of Annex VI; (L.N. 105 of 2025)
Government surveyor (政府驗船師) means a person appointed under section 94 to be a Government surveyor;
HKAPP Certificate (HKAPP證書) means a certificate referred to in section 59 that is issued by the Director;
Hong Kong Air Pollution Prevention Certificate (香港防止空氣污染證書) means—(a)a HKAPP certificate; or(b)a Hong Kong Air Pollution Prevention Certificate issued by a recognized organization;
IAPP Certificate (IAPP證書) means a certificate referred to in section 58 that is issued by the Director;
identification data (識別數據), in relation to a ship, means the data specified in Appendix IX to Annex VI for identifying the ship; (L.N. 21 of 2019)
IEE Certificate (IEE證書) means a certificate referred to in section 60 that is issued by the Director;
IMO means the International Maritime Organization;

International Air Pollution Prevention Certificate (國際防止空氣污染證書) means—(a)an IAPP Certificate;(b)an International Air Pollution Prevention Certificate issued by a recognized organization; or(c)an International Air Pollution Prevention Certificate issued by or under the authority of an Administration;

def.name: InternationalAirPollutionPreventionExemptionCertificateForUnmannedNonselfpropelledUNSPBarges
def.leadIn: International Air Pollution Prevention Exemption Certificate for Unmanned Non-self-propelled (UNSP) Barges (無人非自航駁船國際防止空氣污染免除證書) means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an IAPPE Certificate;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an International Air Pollution Prevention Exemption Certificate for Unmanned Non-self-propelled (UNSP) Barges issued by a recognized organization; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: an International Air Pollution Prevention Exemption Certificate for Unmanned Non-self-propelled (UNSP) Barges issued by or under the authority of an Administration; (L.N. 157 of 2022)

subsection.def: International Energy Efficiency Certificate (國際能效證書) means—(a)an IEE Certificate;(b)an International Energy Efficiency Certificate issued by a recognized organization; or(c)an International Energy Efficiency Certificate issued by or under the authority of an Administration;
LNG carrier (LNG運輸船) means a LNG carrier as defined in Regulation 2 of Annex VI;
local supplier (本地供應商) means a person who delivers fuel oil to a ship in Hong Kong;
low-flashpoint fuel (低閃點燃料) has the meaning given by Regulation 2 of Annex VI; (L.N. 105 of 2025)
major modification (重大改動), in relation to a ship, means a major conversion of the ship as defined in Regulation 2 of Annex VI;

new ship (新船) means a ship—(a)for which the building contract is placed on or after 1 January 2013;(b)(if there is no building contract) which is constructed on or after 1 July 2013; or(c)the delivery of which is on or after 1 July 2015;

NOx Technical Code (《氮氧化物技術規則》) means the Technical Code on Control of Emission of Nitrogen Oxides from Marine Diesel Engines adopted by IMO resolution MEPC.177(58) on 10 October 2008, as from time to time revised or amended by any revision or amendment that applies to Hong Kong;

non-Chapter 4 ship (非第4章船舶) means—(a)a ship that is not propelled by mechanical means; or(b)a platform (including a floating production storage and offloading facility, a floating storage unit and a drilling rig);
non-Hong Kong ship (非香港船舶) means a ship other than a Hong Kong ship;

non-international voyage (非國際航程) means—(a)a voyage that begins and ends within the waters of Hong Kong, during the course of which the ship concerned does not call at any port outside Hong Kong; or(b)a voyage between Hong Kong and any other port in the People’s Republic of China, during the course of which the ship concerned does not call at any port outside the People’s Republic of China;

def.name: OperationalCarbonIntensityRating
def.leadIn: operational carbon intensity rating (營運碳強度評級) means a rating assigned to a ship—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: in accordance with Regulation 28 of Annex VI taking into account the guidelines developed by IMO; (L.N. 157 of 2022)

subsection.def: ozone depleting substance (消耗臭氧物質) means any controlled substance defined in paragraph 4 of article 1 of the Montreal Protocol on Substances that Deplete the Ozone Layer, 1987, as listed in Annex A, B, C or E to the Protocol, as from time to time revised or amended by any revision or amendment that applies to Hong Kong;

Polar Code (《極地規則》) means the International Code for Ships Operating in Polar Waters, adopted by IMO Resolutions MSC.385(94) and MEPC.264(68), as from time to time revised or amended by any revision or amendment to any provision of the Code that applies to Hong Kong; (L.N. 122 of 2020)
post-2019 LNG carrier (2019年後LNG運輸船) means a LNG carrier delivered on or after 1 September 2019;
recognized organization (認可機構) means an organization recognized by the Director under section 95;

regulated diesel engine (受規管柴油機) means any one of the following engines which has a power output of more than 130 kW, and includes a booster or compound system that is fitted to the engine—(a)a gas fuelled engine; or(b)a reciprocating internal combustion engine operating on liquid or dual fuel,but does not include—(c)an engine which is intended to be used solely for emergencies;(d)an engine which is solely to power any device or equipment intended to be used solely for emergencies on the ship on which it is installed; and(e)an engine installed in a lifeboat intended to be used solely for emergencies;

required annual operational CII (要求的年度營運碳強度指標) means the target value of the attained annual operational CII of a ship determined in accordance with Regulations 26 and 28 of Annex VI; (L.N. 157 of 2022)
Required EEDI (要求的能效設計指數) means the maximum value of the Attained EEDI that is allowed for a ship as determined in accordance with Regulation 24 of Annex VI; (L.N. 157 of 2022)
required EEXI (現有船舶要求的能效指數) means the maximum value of the attained EEXI that is allowed for a ship determined in accordance with Regulation 25 of Annex VI; (L.N. 157 of 2022)
special ship (特殊船舶) means—(a)a specified non-conventional propulsion ship; or(b)a Category A ship as defined by section 2 of the Introduction of the Polar Code; (L.N. 122 of 2020)
specified Certificate (指明證書) means an International Air Pollution Prevention Certificate or a Hong Kong Air Pollution Prevention Certificate;

specified non-conventional propulsion ship (指明非常規推進船舶) means a ship which has a non-conventional propulsion system except—(a)a post-2019 cruise passenger ship; or(b)a post-2019 LNG carrier; (L.N. 21 of 2019)
Statement of Compliance (遵規證明) means a Statement of Compliance issued under section 60A; (L.N. 21 of 2019; L.N. 157 of 2022)
UNSP barge (無人非自航駁船) means an unmanned non-self-propelled (UNSP) barge as defined in Regulation 2 of Annex VI. (L.N. 157 of 2022)

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsection (1), a cruise passenger ship or LNG carrier is delivered on or after 1 September 2019 if it is a cruise passenger ship or LNG carrier—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: for which the building contract is placed on or after 1 September 2015;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: (if there is no building contract) which is constructed on or after 1 March 2016; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the delivery of which is on or after 1 September 2019.

subsection.content: In this Regulation, in relation to a barge that does not have a master, a reference to the master is a reference to the operator of the barge. (L.N. 157 of 2022)

subsection.leadIn: This Regulation applies to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a Hong Kong ship wherever it may be; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a non-Hong Kong ship within the waters of Hong Kong.

subsection.leadIn: This Regulation does not apply to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a warship;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a naval auxiliary; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: any other ship owned or operated by a government and used only on government non-commercial service.

division.name: D1
division.heading: Application and Requirement for Certificates etc.

section.name: s4
section.heading: Application of this Part
section.content: This Part applies to a ship engaged in international voyages.

section.name: s5
section.heading: Ships engaged in international voyages to have certain certificates

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (2), if a ship of 400 gross tonnage or above (other than a non-Chapter 4 ship) is engaged in an international voyage, there must be in force in respect of the ship the following certificates—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an International Air Pollution Prevention Certificate; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an International Energy Efficiency Certificate.

subsection.leadIn: Subsection (1)(b) does not apply to a ship before the completion of the earlier of the following surveys of the ship for endorsing or renewing an International Air Pollution Prevention Certificate—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: in relation to a Hong Kong ship—

subparagraph.content:
the first intermediate survey carried out in accordance with section 77 after the commencement#
of this Regulation; or

the first renewal survey carried out in accordance with section 76 after the commencement#
of this Regulation;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: in relation to a non-Hong Kong ship—

subparagraph.content:
the first intermediate survey carried out by an Administration after the commencement#
of this Regulation; or

the first renewal survey carried out by an Administration after the commencement#
of this Regulation.

subsection.content: If a non-Chapter 4 ship of 400 gross tonnage or above is engaged in an international voyage, there must be in force in respect of the ship an International Air Pollution Prevention Certificate.

subsection.leadIn: Section 5(1) does not prevent a ship from being engaged in an international voyage if there is in force in respect of the ship the following certificates or documents issued by or under the authority of an Administration—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a certificate or document (other than an International Air Pollution Prevention Certificate) certifying or confirming that the ship is in compliance with Chapter 3 of Annex VI; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a certificate or document (other than an International Energy Efficiency Certificate) certifying or confirming that the ship is in compliance with Chapter 4 of Annex VI.

subsection.content: Section 5(3) does not prevent a non-Chapter 4 ship from being engaged in an international voyage if there is in force in respect of the ship a certificate or document (other than an International Air Pollution Prevention Certificate) issued by or under the authority of an Administration certifying or confirming that the ship is in compliance with Chapter 3 of Annex VI.

A UNSP barge in respect of which an International Air Pollution Prevention Exemption Certificate for Unmanned Non-self-propelled (UNSP) Barges is in force is exempted from section 5(3). (L.N. 157 of 2022)

section.name: s6A
section.heading: Ships engaged in international voyages must have Fuel Oil Consumption Reporting and Operational Carbon Intensity Compliance Statements

subsection.leadIn: This section applies to a ship—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: that is of 5 000 gross tonnage or above;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: that is not a non-Chapter 4 ship; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: that is engaged in an international voyage.

subsection.content: A ship must have in force in respect of it a Fuel Oil Consumption Reporting and Operational Carbon Intensity Compliance Statement. (L.N. 157 of 2022)
If a ship is put into service on or before 31 May 2019, subsection (2) applies to it with effect from 1 June 2020.
If a ship is put into service on a day in a calendar year (being a day after 31 May 2019), subsection (2) applies to it with effect from 1 June of the next calendar year.

section.name: s7
section.heading: Prohibition on emission of ozone depleting substances

subsection.content: A ship is not to be engaged in any deliberate emission of ozone depleting substances as referred to in Regulation 12 of Annex VI.

subsection.leadIn: Subsection (1) does not apply to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an emission referred to in Regulation 3 of Annex VI; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any minimal releases associated with the recapture or recycling of an ozone depleting substance.

section.name: s8
section.heading: Installations containing ozone depleting substances prohibited

subsection.content: An installation which contains ozone depleting substances, including hydro-chlorofluorocarbons, is prohibited on a ship referred to in Regulation 12 of Annex VI.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: installation (裝置) means—(a)a system or equipment (including a portable fire-extinguishing unit), insulation or other material that contains ozone depleting substances (other than hydro-chlorofluorocarbons) which is installed on a ship but does not include—(i)any repair or recharge of such system, equipment, insulation or other material which is installed before 19 May 2005;(ii)any recharge of a portable fire-extinguishing unit which is installed before 19 May 2005; and(iii)a permanently sealed equipment referred to in Regulation 12 of Annex VI; and(b)a system or equipment (including a portable fire-extinguishing unit), insulation or other material that contains hydro-chlorofluorocarbons but no other ozone depleting substances which is installed on a ship but does not include—(i)any repair or recharge of such system, equipment, insulation or other material which is installed before 1 January 2020;(ii)any recharge of a portable fire-extinguishing unit which is installed before 1 January 2020; and(iii)a permanently sealed equipment referred to in Regulation 12 of Annex VI.

section.name: s9
section.heading: Delivery of ozone depleting substances to reception facilities
section.content: If any ozone depleting substances or an equipment containing such substances is removed from a ship, the substances and the equipment must be delivered to a reception facility recognized by the appropriate authority of a port.

section.name: s10
section.heading: Duty to maintain list of equipment containing ozone depleting substances

subsection.content: A list of the systems and equipment referred to in subsection (2) must be maintained for a ship of 400 gross tonnage or above and kept on board the ship.

subsection.leadIn: The systems and equipment are all systems and equipment—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: which contain ozone depleting substances; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: which are listed in the supplement to the International Air Pollution Prevention Certificate or the certificate or document referred to in section 6(1)(a) or (2) issued in respect of the ship.

subsection.content: If a ship is of 400 gross tonnage or above and has a rechargeable system that contains ozone depleting substances, an Ozone Depleting Substances Record Book must be maintained for the ship and kept on board the ship, and an entry referred to in section 12 must be made in the Record Book in the manner set out in section 12.

subsection.leadIn: An electronic record book may be used for recording matters to be recorded in the Record Book only if the electronic record book is approved by the following authority after taking into account the guidelines developed by IMO—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: for a Hong Kong ship—the Director; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: for a non-Hong Kong ship—an Administration. (L.N. 122 of 2020)

subsection.content: If the Record Book forms part of the electronic recording system of the ship mentioned in the pre-existing subsection (2) (pre-existing system), the provisions in Regulation 12.6 of Annex VI concerning an electronic recording system apply to the pre-existing system. (L.N. 122 of 2020)

subsection.leadIn: In subsection (3)—
subsection.def: pre-existing subsection (2) (原有第(2)款) means subsection (2) as in force immediately before 1 October 2020. (L.N. 122 of 2020)

subsection.content: On the occurrence of any of the events set out in subsection (2), an entry of the event, in terms of mass (kg) of substance, must be made in the Record Book maintained for a ship referred to in section 11 without delay.

subsection.leadIn: The events are as follows—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the full or partial recharge, repair or maintenance of an equipment which contains ozone depleting substances;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the discharge by the ship of any ozone depleting substances to the atmosphere (whether deliberate or not);

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the discharge by the ship of any ozone depleting substances to any land-based reception facilities; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the supply of any ozone depleting substances to the ship.

section.name: s13
section.heading: Application of this Division
section.content: The requirements in this Division do not apply to an emission referred to in Regulation 3 of Annex VI.

section.name: s14
section.heading: Diesel engines must operate within emission limit
section.content: A regulated diesel engine installed on a ship must not be put into operation unless the emission of nitrogen oxides from the engine is kept within the applicable emission limit set out in Regulation 13 of Annex VI.

section.name: s14A
section.heading: Duty to keep records for certain diesel engines

subsection.content: This section applies to a ship that has installed on it a regulated diesel engine certified to meet the NOx emission standards that are referred to in Regulation 13.5.3 of Annex VI in relation to a marine diesel engine.

subsection.leadIn: There must be kept on board a ship a record showing the information required in relation to a marine diesel engine by Regulation 13.5.3 of Annex VI that is recorded whenever—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the ship enters an NOx Tier III emission control area;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the ship leaves an NOx Tier III emission control area; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the on/off status of the regulated diesel engine of the ship changes within an NOx Tier III emission control area.

subsection.leadIn: An electronic record book may be used for recording matters to be recorded in the record mentioned in subsection (2) only if the electronic record book is approved by the following authority after taking into account the guidelines developed by IMO—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: for a Hong Kong ship—the Director; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: for a non-Hong Kong ship—an Administration. (L.N. 122 of 2020)

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: NOx Tier III emission control area (氮氧化物第III層排放控制區) means an area specified in Regulation 13 of Annex VI as an emission control area.

section.name: s15
section.heading: Determination of emission
section.content: In determining whether the emission of nitrogen oxides from a regulated diesel engine is kept within an emission limit, the criteria and procedures as set out in the NOx Technical Code are to be applied.

section.name: s16
section.heading: Interpretation
section.def: SOx Emission Control Area (硫氧化物排放控制區) means an area specified in Regulation 14 of Annex VI as an emission control area.

subsection.content: The sulphur content of any fuel oil used, or carried for use, on board a ship must not exceed the limit set out in Regulation 14.1 of Annex VI. (L.N. 192 of 2019)
However, the sulphur content of any fuel oil used on board a ship within an SOx Emission Control Area must not exceed the limit set out in Regulation 14.4 of Annex VI. (L.N. 192 of 2019)

The owner and the master of a ship of 400 gross tonnage or above must ensure that the requirements on in-use fuel oil sampling point set out in Regulation 14 of Annex VI are complied with in relation to the ship. (L.N. 153 of 2021)

section.name: s18
section.heading: Change-over of fuel oil on entering or leaving SOx Emission Control Area

subsection.leadIn: This section applies to a Hong Kong ship—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: which changes fuel oil of lower sulphur content to fuel oil of higher sulphur content after leaving an SOx Emission Control Area.

subsection.content: Before a ship enters an SOx Emission Control Area, sufficient time must be allowed for the fuel oil service system on the ship to be fully flushed of all fuel oil the sulphur content of which exceeds the limit set out in Regulation 14.4 of Annex VI.
The ship must keep on board a written procedure showing how the change-over of the fuel oil is to be done.

subsection.leadIn: The ship must keep a record on board the ship showing the information referred to in subsection (5) at the following time—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the case of subsection (1)(a), when the change-over of the fuel oil is completed before the ship enters an SOx Emission Control Area; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the case of subsection (1)(b), when the change-over of the fuel oil is commenced after the ship leaves an SOx Emission Control Area.

subsection.leadIn: An electronic record book may be used for recording matters to be recorded in the record mentioned in subsection (4) only if the electronic record book is approved by the following authority after taking into account the guidelines developed by IMO—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: for a Hong Kong ship—the Director; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: for a non-Hong Kong ship—an Administration. (L.N. 122 of 2020)

subsection.leadIn: The information referred to in subsection (4) is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the volume of the fuel oil the sulphur content of which is within the limit set out in Regulation 14.4 of Annex VI in each tank; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the date, time and position of the ship.

subsection.content: This section applies if an area is designated as an SOx Emission Control Area by an amendment to Regulation 14.3 of Annex VI.
If a ship is within the area during the period of 12 months beginning on the date on which the amendment comes into force (exemption period), the ship is exempted from section 17(2).
If a ship enters or leaves the area during the exemption period, the ship is exempted from section 18.

section.name: s19
section.heading: Interpretation
section.def: collection system (收集系統) means a system for the collection of volatile organic compounds approved by the Director in accordance with the safety standards issued by IMO;

designated port or terminal (指定港口或碼頭) means a port or terminal—(a)which is designated by a Convention country as a port or terminal at which emission of volatile organic compounds is to be regulated; and(b)for which a notification of the designation has been submitted to IMO pursuant to Regulation 15 of Annex VI;
gas carrier (氣體運輸船) means a cargo ship constructed or adapted for the carriage of any liquefied gas in bulk;
Hong Kong tanker (香港液貨船) means a tanker registered in Hong Kong;
tanker (液貨船) has the meaning given by Regulation 2 of Annex VI in relation to the control over the emission of volatile organic compounds.

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsections (2) and (3), a Hong Kong tanker within a designated port or terminal must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: be equipped with a collection system; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: use the system during the loading of the cargoes the types of which are specified in the notification of the designation of the port or the terminal submitted to IMO.

subsection.content: A tanker is not required to comply with subsection (1) within 3 years after the effective date specified in the notification if the operator of the port or the terminal allows the tanker to load the cargoes at the port or the terminal.

If a tanker is a gas carrier, subsection (1) only applies if the type of loading and containment systems of the tanker allow the safe retention of non-methane volatile organic compounds on board or the safe return of such compounds ashore.

section.name: s21
section.heading: Tanker carrying crude oil to have VOC Management Plan
section.content: A tanker carrying crude oil must have on board, and implement, a Volatile Organic Compounds Management Plan which is specific to the ship and which is approved by the Director, a recognized organization or an Administration in accordance with the guidelines issued by IMO.

section.name: s22
section.heading: Interpretation
section.def: approved incinerator (認可焚化爐) means a shipboard incinerator which belongs to a type of shipboard incinerator in respect of which a Type Approval Certificate has been issued;

post-2000 incinerator (2000年後焚化爐) means a shipboard incinerator—(a)which is installed on a ship that is constructed on or after 1 January 2000; or(b)which is installed on a ship on or after 1 January 2000;
sewage sludge (污泥淤渣) means the sediment of sewage;
shipboard incineration (船上焚化) means the incineration on board a ship of waste, or other matter, which has been generated during the normal operation of the ship;
shipboard incinerator (船上焚化爐) means a shipboard facility designed for the primary purpose of incineration;

sludge oil (油類淤渣) means—(a)sludge from fuel or lubricating oil separators;(b)waste lubricating oil from main or auxiliary machinery; or(c)waste oil from bilge water separators, oil filtering equipment or drip trays;

Type Approval Certificate (型式認可證書) means a Certificate of Shipboard Incinerator issued by the Director or issued by or under the authority of an Administration certifying that a type of shipboard incinerator has been examined and tested in accordance with the standard specification issued by IMO.

section.name: s23
section.heading: Requirements on shipboard incineration for ships within waters of Hong Kong

subsection.content: Shipboard incineration must not take place on board a ship which is within the waters of Hong Kong unless the requirements set out in this section are complied with.
Subject to subsection (6), the incineration must be conducted in an approved incinerator.

subsection.leadIn: If an approved incinerator is a post-2000 incinerator—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: it must operate within the limits set out in Appendix IV to Annex VI;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the additional requirements in section 25 must be complied with;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: an operating manual referred to in subsection (4) in relation to the incinerator must be kept on board the ship; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the operator of the incinerator must be trained in such a way as to be capable of implementing the guidance provided in the operating manual.

subsection.leadIn: The operating manual is one—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: which is issued by the manufacturer of the incinerator; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: which provides guidance on how the incinerator may be operated within the limits set out in Appendix IV to Annex VI.

subsection.content: The substance for incineration must not be a substance which is listed in Regulation 16.2 of Annex VI.

If the substance for shipboard incineration is sewage sludge, or sludge oil, generated during the normal operation of the ship, the incineration may take place in the main or auxiliary power plant or boilers of the ship while it is not inside a port, harbour or estuary.

section.name: s24
section.heading: Requirements on shipboard incineration for Hong Kong ships outside waters of Hong Kong

subsection.content: Shipboard incineration must not take place on board a Hong Kong ship which is outside the waters of Hong Kong unless the requirements set out in this section are complied with.
Subject to subsections (6) and (7), the incineration must be conducted in a shipboard incinerator.

subsection.leadIn: If a shipboard incinerator is a post-2000 incinerator—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: it must operate within the limits set out in Appendix IV to Annex VI;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the additional requirements in section 25 must be complied with;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: an operating manual referred to in subsection (4) in relation to the incinerator must be kept on board the ship; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the operator of the incinerator must be trained in such a way as to be capable of implementing the guidance provided in the operating manual.

subsection.leadIn: The operating manual is one—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: which is issued by the manufacturer of the incinerator; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: which provides guidance on how the incinerator may be operated within the limits set out in Appendix IV to Annex VI.

subsection.content: The substance for incineration must not be a substance which is listed in Regulation 16.2 of Annex VI.
If the substance for shipboard incineration is polyvinyl chlorides, the incineration must be conducted in an approved incinerator.

If the substance for shipboard incineration is sewage sludge, or sludge oil, generated during the normal operation of the ship, the incineration may take place in the main or auxiliary power plant or boilers of the ship while it is not inside a port, harbour or estuary.
This section applies to a post-2000 incinerator.
The temperature of the combustion chamber gas outlet of the incinerator during combustion is to be monitored at all times.

subsection.leadIn: If the incinerator is a batch-loaded shipboard incinerator, it must not be put into operation unless by its design the following requirements are met—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the temperature of its combustion chamber gas outlet reaches 600oC within 5 minutes after it is started up; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the temperature stabilizes at not less than 850oC after 5 minutes.

subsection.content: If the incinerator is a continuous-feed shipboard incinerator, waste must not be fed into it when the combustion chamber gas outlet temperature is below 850oC.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the incinerator is a batch-loaded shipboard incinerator if the loading of waste is carried out in separate batches as may be required; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the incinerator is a continuous-feed shipboard incinerator if the process during which waste is fed into the combustion chamber of the incinerator without human assistance is carried out while the incinerator is in normal operating conditions and the combustion chamber operative temperature is kept between 850oC and 1 200oC.

section.name: s26
section.heading: Application of this Division
section.leadIn: This Division does not apply to a ship which uses—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: coal in solid form; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: nuclear fuels.

section.name: s27
section.heading: Fuel oil quality
section.content: The quality of fuel oil used on board a ship must meet the requirements set out in Regulation 18 of Annex VI.

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (2), this Division applies to a ship— (L.N. 157 of 2022)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: which is of 400 gross tonnage or above; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: which belongs to one of the categories of ship referred to in Regulation 22 of Annex VI. (L.N. 157 of 2022)

subsection.leadIn: This Division does not apply to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a non-Chapter 4 ship; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a special ship.

subsection.leadIn: An Attained EEDI must be calculated for—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a new ship before it is put into service;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a new ship after it has undergone a major modification; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a modified existing ship after the major modification.

subsection.content: Where a ship belongs to a type of ship the reference line values and the reduction factors of which are set out in Annex VI, the Attained EEDI of the ship must be less than or equals to the Required EEDI of the ship calculated according to the reference line values and the reduction factors that are applicable to the ship as specified in Annex VI.

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (2), this Division applies to a ship—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: that is of 400 gross tonnage or above; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: that belongs to one of the categories of ship referred to in Regulation 23 of Annex VI.

subsection.leadIn: This Division does not apply to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a non-Chapter 4 ship;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a ship that has a non-conventional propulsion system except for a cruise passenger ship or a LNG carrier; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a Category A ship as defined by section 2 of the Introduction of the Polar Code.

section.name: s29B
section.heading: Requirement for attained Energy Efficiency Existing Ship Index

subsection.content: An attained EEXI must be calculated for a ship.
After a ship has undergone a major modification, the attained EEXI must be calculated again for the ship.

If a ship belongs to a type of ship the reference line values and the reduction factors of which are set out in Annex VI, the attained EEXI of the ship must be less than or equal to the required EEXI of the ship calculated according to the reference line values and the reduction factors that are applicable to the ship as specified in Annex VI.

Subject to subsection (3), a ship of 400 gross tonnage or above, other than a non-Chapter 4 ship, must keep on board a Ship Energy Efficiency Management Plan that complies with the requirement in this section in respect of the ship (SEEM Plan).
The SEEM Plan must be developed and reviewed taking into account the guidelines developed by IMO in relation to the development of a Ship Energy Efficiency Management Plan.

subsection.leadIn: For an existing ship, the SEEM Plan must be placed on board the ship no later than the earlier of the following— (L.N. 157 of 2022)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content:
the date of the first intermediate survey of the ship after the commencement#
of this Regulation for the endorsement of the International Air Pollution Prevention Certificate issued in respect of the ship; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content:
the date of the first renewal survey of the ship after the commencement#
of this Regulation for the issue of an International Air Pollution Prevention Certificate in respect of the ship.

subsection.leadIn: For a ship of 5 000 gross tonnage or above, the SEEM Plan must include—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a description of the methodology that will be used to collect the consumption data of the ship;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a description of the process that will be followed in reporting the consumption data to the Director or a recognized organization; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a confirmation regarding compliance with paragraphs (a) and (b) issued by the Director or a recognized organization taking into account the guidelines developed by IMO. (L.N. 157 of 2022)

subsection.leadIn: For a ship of 5 000 gross tonnage or above that belongs to one of the categories of ship referred to in Regulation 26.3 of Annex VI, the SEEM Plan must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: include the information set out in Regulation 26.3.1 of Annex VI;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: include a confirmation regarding compliance with paragraph (a) issued by the Director or a recognized organization taking into account the guidelines developed by IMO; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: be verified by the Director or a recognized organization and is subject to company audits taking into account the guidelines developed by IMO. (L.N. 157 of 2022)

subsection.leadIn: Subsection (7) applies to a ship that is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: assigned an operational carbon intensity rating of “D” for 3 consecutive calendar years; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: assigned an operational carbon intensity rating of “E” for any calendar year. (L.N. 157 of 2022)

subsection.leadIn: For a ship to which this subsection applies—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: the SEEM Plan of the ship must be reviewed to include the plan of corrective actions; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the revised SEEM Plan must be submitted to the Director or a recognized organization for verification within 1 month after the attained annual operational CII is reported under section 30H(2). (L.N. 157 of 2022)

section.name: s30A
section.heading: Application of this Division
section.leadIn: This Division applies to a Hong Kong ship—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: that is of 5 000 gross tonnage or above; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: that is not a non-Chapter 4 ship.

section.name: s30B
section.heading: Collecting consumption data and way of collecting
section.content: For the purposes of sections 30C, 30D, 30E and 30F, the consumption data of a ship must be collected in accordance with the methodology specified in the Ship Energy Efficiency Management Plan required by section 30 to be kept on board the ship.

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (3), this section applies to a ship—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: that is registered in Hong Kong throughout a calendar year after 2018; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: that becomes registered in Hong Kong on a day in a calendar year after 2018 and remains so on 31 December of the year.

subsection.leadIn: The owner of a ship—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: must aggregate by item the consumption data of the ship collected for a calendar year;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: must report the data aggregated under paragraph (a), together with the identification data of the ship, to the Director or a recognized organization by electronic means in the form specified in Appendix IX to Annex VI by 31 March of the next calendar year;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: must keep the consumption data of the ship collected for a calendar year until the expiry of 31 December of the next calendar year; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: must report the data mentioned in paragraph (c) to the Director or a recognized organization at the Director’s or the organization’s request made during the period the data is required to be kept under that paragraph.

subsection.content: This section does not apply to a ship if section 30E or 30F applies in relation to the ship.

section.name: s30D
section.heading: Reporting consumption data on transfer of registry

subsection.content: This section applies if a ship ceases to be registered in Hong Kong and is registered in another place instead on a day (transfer day) in a calendar year.

subsection.leadIn: The owner of the ship—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: must report the data aggregated under paragraph (a), together with the identification data of the ship, to the Director or a recognized organization by electronic means in the form specified in Appendix IX to Annex VI within 30 days beginning on the transfer day;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: must keep the consumption data of the ship collected for the registered period until the expiry of 12 months after the transfer day; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: must report the data mentioned in paragraph (c) to the Director or a recognized organization at the Director’s or the organization’s request made during the period the data is required to be kept under that paragraph.

section.name: s30E
section.heading: Reporting consumption data on change of owner

subsection.content: This section applies if a person (new owner) replaces another person (original owner) as the owner of a ship on a day (replacement day) in a calendar year.

subsection.leadIn: The original owner—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: must report the data aggregated under paragraph (a), together with the identification data of the ship, to the Director or a recognized organization by electronic means in the form specified in Appendix IX to Annex VI within 30 days beginning on the replacement day;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: must keep the consumption data of the ship collected for period A until the expiry of 12 months after the replacement day; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: must report the data mentioned in paragraph (c) to the Director or a recognized organization at the Director’s or the organization’s request made during the period the data is required to be kept under that paragraph.

subsection.leadIn: The new owner—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.leadIn: must report the data aggregated under paragraph (a), together with the identification data of the ship, to the Director or a recognized organization by electronic means in the form specified in Appendix IX to Annex VI—

subparagraph.content: otherwise—by 31 March of the next calendar year;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: must keep the consumption data of the ship collected for period B—

subparagraph.content: if the new owner is subsequently replaced by another person as the owner of the ship on a day in the year—until the expiry of 12 months after that day; or
otherwise—until the expiry of 31 December of the next calendar year; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: must report the data mentioned in paragraph (c) to the Director or a recognized organization at the Director’s or the organization’s request made during the period the data is required to be kept under that paragraph.

section.name: s30F
section.heading: Reporting consumption data on change of company

subsection.content: This section applies if an organization or person (new company) replaces another organization or person (original company) as the company of a ship on a day (replacement day) in a calendar year.

subsection.leadIn: The original company—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: must report the data aggregated under paragraph (a), together with the identification data of the ship, to the Director or a recognized organization by electronic means in the form specified in Appendix IX to Annex VI within 30 days beginning on the replacement day;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: must keep the consumption data of the ship collected for period A until the expiry of 12 months after the replacement day; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: must report the data mentioned in paragraph (c) to the Director or a recognized organization at the Director’s or the organization’s request made during the period the data is required to be kept under that paragraph.

subsection.leadIn: The new company—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.leadIn: must report the data aggregated under paragraph (a), together with the identification data of the ship, to the Director or a recognized organization by electronic means in the form specified in Appendix IX to Annex VI—

subparagraph.content: if the new company is subsequently replaced by another organization or person as the company of the ship on a day in the year—within 30 days beginning on that day; or
otherwise—by 31 March of the next calendar year;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: must keep the consumption data of the ship collected for period B—

subparagraph.content: if the new company is subsequently replaced by another organization or person as the company of the ship on a day in the year—until the expiry of 12 months after that day; or
otherwise—until the expiry of 31 December of the next calendar year; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: must report the data mentioned in paragraph (c) to the Director or a recognized organization at the Director’s or the organization’s request made during the period the data is required to be kept under that paragraph.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: company (公司), in relation to a ship, means an organization or person, such as the manager, or the bareboat charterer, of the ship, who—(a)has assumed responsibility for the operation of the ship from the owner of the ship; and(b)on assuming the responsibility, has agreed to take over all the duties and responsibilities imposed in respect of the ship by the International Management Code for the Safe Operation of Ships and for Pollution Prevention adopted by IMO, as from time to time revised or amended by any revision or amendment that applies to Hong Kong.

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (2), this Division applies to a ship—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: that is of 5 000 gross tonnage or above; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: that belongs to one of the categories of ship referred to in Regulation 28.1 of Annex VI.

subsection.leadIn: This Division does not apply to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a non-Chapter 4 ship; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a Category A ship as defined by section 2 of the Introduction of the Polar Code.

section.name: s30H
section.heading: Attained annual operational carbon intensity indicator

subsection.content: After the end of the year of 2023 and of each subsequent calendar year, the attained annual operational CII of a ship must be calculated for the year using the consumption data collected in accordance with Division 9A and taking into account the guidelines developed by IMO.

The attained annual operational CII calculated for a year must be reported to the Director or a recognized organization within 3 months after the end of the year taking into account the guidelines developed by IMO.
The reporting required by subsection (2) must be done by electronic means in the form developed by IMO.

If any of the requirements in section 5(1) or (3), 6A(2), 7(1), 8(1), 9, 10(1), 11(1), 12(1), 14, 17(1), (2) or (3), 18(2) or (3), 20(1), 21, 23(1), 24(1) or 30(1) is contravened in respect of a ship, the owner and the master of the ship each commits an offence. (L.N. 21 of 2019; L.N. 153 of 2021)
If any of the requirements in section 11(2), 14A(2A), 18(4A) or 29(1) or (2) is contravened in respect of a ship, the owner of the ship commits an offence. (L.N. 122 of 2020)
If any of the requirements in section 14A(2) or 18(4) is contravened in respect of a ship, the master of the ship commits an offence. (L.N. 21 of 2019)
If section 27 is contravened in respect of a ship, the owner and the master of the ship each commits an offence.

subsection.leadIn: A person who commits an offence under this section is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on conviction on indictment to a fine at level 6; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on summary conviction to a fine at level 3.

subsection.content: It is a defence for a person charged under subsection (1), (2) or (3) to show that the person had taken all reasonable steps to prevent the commission of the offence.

subsection.leadIn: It is a defence for a person charged under subsection (4) to show that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the person had taken all reasonable steps to prevent the commission of the offence;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: fuel oil the quality of which meets the requirements referred to in section 27 was not available for purchase; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: the person had notified the following authority of the fact set out in paragraph (b)—

subparagraph.content: (if the ship concerned is a Hong Kong ship) the Director; and
the appropriate authority of the ship’s next port of destination.

subsection.content: If an offence under this section is committed, or would, save for the operation of subsection (6) or (7), have been committed by the owner or the master of a ship due to the act or omission of some other person, that other person also commits the offence and may be charged with and convicted of the offence whether or not proceedings are taken against the owner or the master.
This Part applies to a ship engaged in non-international voyages.
This Part does not apply to a ship which is specified in section 10 of the Merchant Shipping (Local Vessels) Ordinance (Cap. 548).

section.name: s33
section.heading: Ships engaged in non-international voyages to have certain certificates

subsection.content: Subject to subsection (2), if a ship of 400 gross tonnage or above is engaged in a non-international voyage, there must be in force in respect of the ship an International Air Pollution Prevention Certificate or a Hong Kong Air Pollution Prevention Certificate.
Subsection (1) does not apply to a ship that is not self-propelled.

section.name: s34
section.heading: Exception to section 33
section.content: Section 33 does not prevent a ship from being engaged in a non-international voyage if there is in force in respect of the ship a certificate or document issued by or under the authority of an Administration the effect of which is recognized by the Director as equivalent to that of an International Air Pollution Prevention Certificate or a Hong Kong Air Pollution Prevention Certificate.

section.name: s35
section.heading: Prohibition on emission of ozone depleting substances

subsection.content: A ship is not to be engaged in any deliberate emission of ozone depleting substances as referred to in Regulation 12 of Annex VI.

subsection.leadIn: Subsection (1) does not apply to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an emission referred to in Regulation 3 of Annex VI; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any minimal releases associated with the recapture or recycling of an ozone depleting substance.

section.name: s36
section.heading: Installations containing ozone depleting substances prohibited

subsection.content: An installation which contains ozone depleting substances, including hydro-chlorofluorocarbons, is prohibited on a ship referred to in Regulation 12 of Annex VI.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: installation (裝置) means—(a)a system or equipment (including a portable fire-extinguishing unit), insulation or other material that contains ozone depleting substances (other than hydro-chlorofluorocarbons) which is installed on a ship but does not include—(i)any repair or recharge of such system, equipment, insulation or other material which is installed before 19 May 2005;(ii)any recharge of a portable fire-extinguishing unit which is installed before 19 May 2005; and(iii)a permanently sealed equipment referred to in Regulation 12 of Annex VI; and(b)a system or equipment (including a portable fire-extinguishing unit), insulation or other material that contains hydro-chlorofluorocarbons but no other ozone depleting substances which is installed on a ship but does not include—(i)any repair or recharge of such system, equipment, insulation or other material which is installed before 1 January 2020;(ii)any recharge of a portable fire-extinguishing unit which is installed before 1 January 2020; and(iii)a permanently sealed equipment referred to in Regulation 12 of Annex VI.

section.name: s37
section.heading: Delivery of ozone depleting substances to reception facilities
section.content: If any ozone depleting substances or an equipment containing such substances is removed from a ship, the substances and the equipment must be delivered to a reception facility recognized by the appropriate authority of a port.

section.name: s38
section.heading: Duty to maintain list of equipment containing ozone depleting substances

subsection.content: A list of the systems and equipment referred to in subsection (2) must be maintained for a ship of 400 gross tonnage or above and kept on board the ship.

subsection.leadIn: The systems and equipment are all systems and equipment—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: which contain ozone depleting substances; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: which are listed in the supplement to the Hong Kong Air Pollution Prevention Certificate, the International Air Pollution Prevention Certificate or the certificate or document referred to in section 34 issued in respect of the ship.

subsection.content: If a ship is of 400 gross tonnage or above and has a rechargeable system that contains ozone depleting substances, an Ozone Depleting Substances Record Book must be maintained for the ship and kept on board the ship, and an entry referred to in section 40 must be made in the Record Book in the manner set out in section 40.

subsection.leadIn: An electronic record book may be used for recording matters to be recorded in the Record Book only if the electronic record book is approved by the following authority after taking into account the guidelines developed by IMO—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: for a Hong Kong ship—the Director; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: for a non-Hong Kong ship—an Administration. (L.N. 122 of 2020)

subsection.content: If the Record Book forms part of the electronic recording system of the ship mentioned in the pre-existing subsection (2) (pre-existing system), the provisions in Regulation 12.6 of Annex VI concerning an electronic recording system apply to the pre-existing system. (L.N. 122 of 2020)

For subsection (3), the reference to an International Air Pollution Prevention Certificate in Regulation 12.6 of Annex VI is to be construed as a reference to such a certificate or a Hong Kong Air Pollution Prevention Certificate. (L.N. 122 of 2020)

subsection.leadIn: In subsection (3)—
subsection.def: pre-existing subsection (2) (原有第(2)款) means subsection (2) as in force immediately before 1 October 2020. (L.N. 122 of 2020)

subsection.content: On the occurrence of any of the events set out in subsection (2), an entry of the event, in terms of mass (kg) of substance, must be made in the Record Book maintained for a ship referred to in section 39 without delay.

subsection.leadIn: The events are as follows—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the full or partial recharge, repair or maintenance of an equipment which contains ozone depleting substances;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the discharge by the ship of any ozone depleting substances to the atmosphere (whether deliberate or not);

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the discharge by the ship of any ozone depleting substances to any land-based reception facilities; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the supply of any ozone depleting substances to the ship.

section.name: s41
section.heading: Application of this Division and interpretation

subsection.leadIn: This Division does not apply to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a regulated diesel engine installed on a ship that is constructed before 1 June 2008; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a regulated diesel engine that is subject to an alternative nitrogen oxide control measure which is accepted by the Director.

subsection.content: The regulated diesel engine referred to in subsection (1)(a) does not include a regulated diesel engine that has undergone a major conversion on or after 1 June 2008.
The requirements in this Division do not apply to an emission referred to in Regulation 3 of Annex VI.

subsection.name: 3A
subsection.content: For the purposes of this Division, replacement by a marine diesel engine (being a regulated diesel engine) for a steam system is regarded as replacement by a regulated diesel engine for a non-identical regulated diesel engine. (L.N. 105 of 2025)

subsection.leadIn: In this Division—
subsection.def: g/kWh means gram per kilowatt-hour;

major conversion (重大改裝), in relation to a regulated diesel engine that has not been certified to meet the NOx emission standards set out in Regulation 13 of Annex VI, means—(a)a replacement of the engine by another regulated diesel engine;(b)the installation of an additional regulated diesel engine;(c)a substantial modification, as defined in the NOx Technical Code, is made to the engine; or(d)a modification of the engine by which the maximum continuous rating of the engine is increased by more than 10%, as compared to the maximum continuous rating of the engine before the modification;
n means rated engine speed (crankshaft revolutions per minute);
rpm means revolutions per minute.

section.name: s42
section.heading: Diesel engines installed on ships constructed on or after commencement of this Regulation and certain other diesel engines must operate within emission limits

subsection.leadIn: This section applies to a regulated diesel engine—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.leadIn:
which on or after the commencement#
of this Regulation—

subparagraph.content: replaces a non-identical regulated diesel engine installed on a ship; or
is installed on a ship as an additional regulated diesel engine; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn:
which is installed on a ship constructed on or after 1 January 2011 and which on or after the commencement#
of this Regulation has undergone—

subparagraph.content: a substantial modification as defined in the NOx Technical Code; or
a modification by which the maximum continuous rating of the engine is increased by more than 10%, as compared to the maximum continuous rating of the engine before the modification.

subsection.content:
If a regulated diesel engine referred to in subsection (1) is replaced by an identical regulated diesel engine on or after the commencement#
of this Regulation, the identical engine is to be regarded as the engine that it has replaced.

subsection.leadIn: A regulated diesel engine must not be put into operation unless the emission of nitrogen oxides from the engine is kept within the following limits—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: 14.4 g/kWh when n is less than 130 rpm;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: 44 ․ n(-0.23) g/kWh when n is 130 rpm or more but less than 2 000 rpm; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: 7.7 g/kWh when n is 2 000 rpm or more.

section.name: s43
section.heading: Diesel engines installed on ships constructed before commencement of this Regulation and certain other diesel engines must operate within emission limits

subsection.leadIn: This section applies to a regulated diesel engine—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content:
installed on a ship that is constructed on or after 1 June 2008 but before the commencement#
of this Regulation;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn:
which has undergone a major conversion on or after 1 June 2008 but before the commencement#
of this Regulation and is—

subparagraph.content:
a replacement of a non-identical regulated diesel engine installed on a ship constructed before the commencement#
of this Regulation; or
an additional regulated diesel engine installed on a ship constructed before 1 June 2008; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn:
which is installed on a ship constructed before 1 January 2011 and which on or after the commencement#
of this Regulation has undergone—

subparagraph.content: a substantial modification as defined in the NOx Technical Code; or
a modification by which the maximum continuous rating of the engine is increased by more than 10%, as compared to the maximum continuous rating of the engine before the modification.

subsection.content: If a regulated diesel engine referred to in subsection (1) is replaced by an identical regulated diesel engine on or after 1 June 2008, the identical engine is to be regarded as the engine that it has replaced.

subsection.leadIn: A regulated diesel engine must not be put into operation unless the emission of nitrogen oxides from the engine is kept within the following limits—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: 17.0 g/kWh when n is less than 130 rpm;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: 45 ․ n(-0.2) g/kWh when n is 130 rpm or more but less than 2 000 rpm; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: 9.8 g/kWh when n is 2 000 rpm or more.

section.name: s44
section.heading: Emission limits in section 42 to prevail
section.content: If a regulated diesel engine is an engine to which both sections 42 and 43 apply, the engine must not be put into operation unless the emission of nitrogen oxides from the engine is kept within the limit set out in section 42(3).

section.name: s45
section.heading: Determination of emission
section.content: In determining whether the emission of nitrogen oxides from a regulated diesel engine is kept within a limit which is set out in this Division, the criteria and procedures as set out in the NOx Technical Code are to be applied.

subsection.content: The sulphur content of any fuel oil used, or carried for use, on board a ship must not exceed 0.50% mass per mass. (L.N. 192 of 2019; L.N. 153 of 2021)

The owner and the master of a ship of 400 gross tonnage or above must ensure that the requirements on in-use fuel oil sampling point set out in Regulation 14 of Annex VI are complied with in relation to the ship. (L.N. 153 of 2021)

section.name: s47
section.heading: Interpretation
section.def: collection system (收集系統) means a system for the collection of volatile organic compounds approved by the Director in accordance with the safety standards issued by IMO;

designated port or terminal (指定港口或碼頭) means a port or terminal—(a)which is designated by a Convention country as a port or terminal at which emission of volatile organic compounds is to be regulated; and(b)for which a notification of the designation has been submitted to IMO pursuant to Regulation 15 of Annex VI;
gas carrier (氣體運輸船) means a cargo ship constructed or adapted for the carriage of any liquefied gas in bulk;
Hong Kong tanker (香港液貨船) means a Hong Kong ship which is a tanker;
tanker (液貨船) has the meaning given by Regulation 2 of Annex VI in relation to the control over the emission of volatile organic compounds.

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsections (2) and (3), a Hong Kong tanker within a designated port or terminal must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: be equipped with a collection system; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: use the system during the loading of the cargoes the types of which are specified in the notification of the designation of the port or the terminal submitted to IMO.

subsection.content: A tanker is not required to comply with subsection (1) within 3 years after the effective date specified in the notification if the operator of the port or the terminal allows the tanker to load the cargoes at the port or the terminal.

If a tanker is a gas carrier, subsection (1) only applies if the type of loading and containment systems of the tanker allow the safe retention of non-methane volatile organic compounds on board or the safe return of such compounds ashore.

section.name: s49
section.heading: Tanker carrying crude oil to have VOC Management Plan
section.content: A tanker carrying crude oil must have on board, and implement, a Volatile Organic Compounds Management Plan which is specific to the ship and which is approved by the Director, a recognized organization or an Administration in accordance with the guidelines issued by IMO.

section.name: s50
section.heading: Interpretation
section.def: approved incinerator (認可焚化爐) means a shipboard incinerator which belongs to a type of shipboard incinerator in respect of which a Type Approval Certificate has been issued;

post-2000 incinerator (2000年後焚化爐) means a shipboard incinerator—(a)which is installed on a ship that is constructed on or after 1 January 2000; or(b)which is installed on a ship on or after 1 January 2000;
sewage sludge (污泥淤渣) means the sediment of sewage;
shipboard incineration (船上焚化) means the incineration on board a ship of waste, or other matter, which has been generated during the normal operation of the ship;
shipboard incinerator (船上焚化爐) means a shipboard facility designed for the primary purpose of incineration;

sludge oil (油類淤渣) means—(a)sludge from fuel or lubricating oil separators;(b)waste lubricating oil from main or auxiliary machinery; or(c)waste oil from bilge water separators, oil filtering equipment or drip trays;

Type Approval Certificate (型式認可證書) means a Certificate of Shipboard Incinerator issued by the Director or issued by or under the authority of an Administration certifying that a type of shipboard incinerator has been examined and tested in accordance with the standard specification issued by IMO.

section.name: s51
section.heading: Requirements on shipboard incineration for ships within waters of Hong Kong

subsection.content: Shipboard incineration must not take place on board a ship which is within the waters of Hong Kong unless the requirements set out in this section are complied with.
Subject to subsection (6), the incineration must be conducted in an approved incinerator.

subsection.leadIn: If an approved incinerator is a post-2000 incinerator—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: it must operate within the limits set out in Appendix IV to Annex VI;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the additional requirements in section 53 must be complied with;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: an operating manual referred to in subsection (4) in relation to the incinerator must be kept on board the ship; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the operator of the incinerator must be trained in such a way as to be capable of implementing the guidance provided in the operating manual.

subsection.leadIn: The operating manual is one—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: which is issued by the manufacturer of the incinerator; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: which provides guidance on how the incinerator may be operated within the limits set out in Appendix IV to Annex VI.

subsection.content: The substance for incineration must not be a substance which is listed in Regulation 16.2 of Annex VI.

If the substance for shipboard incineration is sewage sludge, or sludge oil, generated during the normal operation of the ship, the incineration may take place in the main or auxiliary power plant or boilers of the ship while it is not inside a port, harbour or estuary.

section.name: s52
section.heading: Requirements on shipboard incineration for Hong Kong ships outside waters of Hong Kong

subsection.content: Shipboard incineration must not take place on board a Hong Kong ship which is outside the waters of Hong Kong unless the requirements set out in this section are complied with.
Subject to subsections (6) and (7), the incineration must be conducted in a shipboard incinerator.

subsection.leadIn: If a shipboard incinerator is a post-2000 incinerator—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: it must operate within the limits set out in Appendix IV to Annex VI;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the additional requirements in section 53 must be complied with;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: an operating manual referred to in subsection (4) in relation to the incinerator must be kept on board the ship; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the operator of the incinerator must be trained in such a way as to be capable of implementing the guidance provided in the operating manual.

subsection.leadIn: The operating manual is one—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: which is issued by the manufacturer of the incinerator; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: which provides guidance on how the incinerator may be operated within the limits set out in Appendix IV to Annex VI.

subsection.content: The substance for incineration must not be a substance which is listed in Regulation 16.2 of Annex VI.
If the substance for shipboard incineration is polyvinyl chlorides, the incineration must be conducted in an approved incinerator.

If the substance for shipboard incineration is sewage sludge, or sludge oil, generated during the normal operation of the ship, the incineration may take place in the main or auxiliary power plant or boilers of the ship while it is not inside a port, harbour or estuary.
This section applies to a post-2000 incinerator.
The temperature of the combustion chamber gas outlet of the incinerator during combustion is to be monitored at all times.

subsection.leadIn: If the incinerator is a batch-loaded shipboard incinerator, it must not be put into operation unless by its design the following requirements are met—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the temperature of its combustion chamber gas outlet reaches 600oC within 5 minutes after it is started up; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the temperature stabilizes at not less than 850oC after 5 minutes.

subsection.content: If the incinerator is a continuous-feed shipboard incinerator, waste must not be fed into it when the combustion chamber gas outlet temperature is below 850oC.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the incinerator is a batch-loaded shipboard incinerator if the loading of waste is carried out in separate batches as may be required; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the incinerator is a continuous-feed shipboard incinerator if the process during which waste is fed into the combustion chamber of the incinerator without human assistance is carried out while the incinerator is in normal operating conditions and the combustion chamber operative temperature is kept between 850oC and 1 200oC.

section.name: s54
section.heading: Application of this Division
section.leadIn: This Division does not apply to a ship which uses—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: coal in solid form; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: nuclear fuels.

section.name: s55
section.heading: Fuel oil quality
section.content: The quality of fuel oil used on board a ship must meet the requirements set out in Regulation 18 of Annex VI.

subsection.content: If any of the requirements in section 33(1), 35(1), 36(1), 37, 38(1), 39(1), 40(1), 42(3), 43(3), 46(1) or (2), 48(1), 49, 51(1) or 52(1) is contravened in respect of a ship, the owner and the master of the ship each commits an offence. (L.N. 192 of 2019; L.N. 153 of 2021)
If any of the requirements in section 39(2) is contravened in respect of a ship, the owner of the ship commits an offence.
If section 55 is contravened in respect of a ship, the owner and the master of the ship each commits an offence.

subsection.leadIn: A person who commits an offence under this section is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on indictment to a fine at level 6; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on summary conviction to a fine at level 3.

subsection.content: It is a defence for a person charged under subsection (1) or (2) to show that the person had taken all reasonable steps to prevent the commission of the offence.

subsection.leadIn: It is a defence for a person charged under subsection (3) to show that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the person had taken all reasonable steps to prevent the commission of the offence;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: fuel oil the quality of which meets the requirements referred to in section 55 was not available for purchase; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: the person had notified the following authority of the fact set out in paragraph (b)—

subparagraph.content: (if the ship concerned is a Hong Kong ship) the Director; and
the appropriate authority of the ship’s next port of destination.

subsection.content: If an offence under this section is committed, or would, save for the operation of subsection (5) or (6), have been committed by the owner or the master of a ship due to the act or omission of some other person, that other person also commits the offence and may be charged with and convicted of the offence whether or not proceedings are taken against the owner or the master.

part.name: P4
part.heading: IAPP Certificates, IAPPE Certificates, HKAPP Certificates, IEE Certificates and Statements of Compliance

section.name: s57
section.heading: Application of this Part
section.content: This Part applies to a Hong Kong ship of 400 gross tonnage or above.

subsection.content: An owner of a ship may apply to the Director for an IAPP Certificate in respect of the ship.
The application must be accompanied by the prescribed fee for the Certificate.

subsection.leadIn: The Director must not issue an IAPP Certificate in respect of the ship unless the Director is satisfied—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: that—

subparagraph.content: where an IAPP Certificate has never been issued in respect of the ship, an initial survey of the ship has been carried out in accordance with section 75; or
where an IAPP Certificate has been issued in respect of the ship, a renewal survey of the ship has been carried out in accordance with section 76; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: that, on evidence of a declaration of survey forwarded to the Director under section 75 or 76, the equipment, systems, fittings, arrangements and material of the ship comply with the requirements under Chapter 3 of Annex VI.

subsection.content: Subject to subsections (3) and (4), the Director may, on application of the owner of a barge, issue an IAPPE Certificate in respect of the barge.
The application must be accompanied by the prescribed fee for the Certificate.

subsection.leadIn: The Director must not issue an IAPPE Certificate in respect of the barge unless the Director is satisfied—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: if—

subparagraph.content: no International Air Pollution Prevention Exemption Certificate for Unmanned Non-self-propelled (UNSP) Barges is in force in respect of the barge—that an initial survey of the barge has been carried out in accordance with section 80A; or

an International Air Pollution Prevention Exemption Certificate for Unmanned Non-self-propelled (UNSP) Barges is in force in respect of the barge—that a renewal survey of the barge has been carried out in accordance with section 80A; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on evidence of a declaration of survey forwarded under section 80A that the barge is a UNSP barge.

subsection.content: The Director must not issue an IAPPE Certificate in respect of the barge if the barge has any means (whether temporary or permanent) of generating exhaust gas emissions or other air pollutants.
An owner of a ship may apply to the Director for a HKAPP Certificate in respect of the ship.
The application must be accompanied by the prescribed fee for the Certificate.

subsection.leadIn: The Director must not issue a HKAPP Certificate in respect of the ship unless the Director is satisfied—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: that—

subparagraph.content: where a HKAPP Certificate has never been issued in respect of the ship, an initial survey of the ship for the issue of the Certificate has been carried out; or
where a HKAPP Certificate has been issued in respect of the ship, a renewal survey of the ship for the renewal of the Certificate has been carried out; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: that, on evidence of a declaration of survey forwarded to the Director in relation to the initial survey or renewal survey, the equipment, systems, fittings, arrangements and material of the ship comply with the requirements under Part 3. (L.N. 73 of 2020)

subsection.content: An owner of a ship may apply to the Director for an IEE Certificate in respect of the ship.
The application must be accompanied by the prescribed fee for the Certificate.

subsection.leadIn: The Director must not issue an IEE Certificate in respect of the ship unless—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in relation to an existing ship (other than a modified existing ship) or a special ship, the conditions set out in subsection (4) are complied with; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in relation to any other ship, the conditions set out in subsection (5) are complied with.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsection (3)(a), the conditions are—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Director is satisfied that an initial survey of the ship has been carried out in accordance with section 81; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the Director is satisfied that on evidence of a declaration of survey forwarded to the Director under section 81, the Government surveyor concerned is satisfied that the Ship Energy Efficiency Management Plan required by section 30 to be kept on board the ship is placed on board the ship. (L.N. 21 of 2019)

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsection (3)(b), the conditions are—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: where the ship concerned is a ship that has undergone a major modification and the Director has directed that an initial survey of the ship under section 81 is to be carried out, or a new ship which has not undergone any major modification—
