subparagraph.content: the Director is satisfied that the initial survey has been carried out in accordance with section 81; and

the Director is satisfied that on evidence of a declaration of survey forwarded to the Director under section 81, the Government surveyor concerned is satisfied as to the matters set out in section 81(3)(b) in relation to the ship;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: where the ship concerned is a new ship that has undergone a major modification and the Director has directed that an additional survey of the ship under section 82 is to be carried out—

subparagraph.content: the Director is satisfied that the additional survey has been carried out in accordance with section 82; and

the Director is satisfied that on evidence of a declaration of survey forwarded to the Director under section 82, the Government surveyor concerned is satisfied as to the matters set out in section 82(3) in relation to the ship.

subsection.content: The owner of a ship of 5 000 gross tonnage or above (other than a non-Chapter 4 ship) engaged in an international voyage may apply to the Director for a Statement of Compliance in respect of the ship.
The application must be accompanied by the prescribed fee for the Statement.

subsection.leadIn: The Director may issue a Statement of Compliance in respect of a ship on an application made in a calendar year if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Director is satisfied that section 30C(2)(b), 30D(2)(b), 30E(2)(b) or (3)(b), 30F(2)(b) or (3)(b) or 30H(2) (as the case requires) has been complied with in respect of the ship in the year; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the matter reported under that section in respect of the ship in the year has been verified by the Director. (L.N. 157 of 2022)

subsection.name: 3A
subsection.leadIn: Despite subsection (3), the Director may not issue a Statement of Compliance in respect of a ship regarding compliance with section 30H(2) unless—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Director is satisfied that the attained annual operational CII reported under section 30H(2) is calculated on the basis of the consumption data collected using the methodology mentioned in section 30(4)(a);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the Director has assigned an operational carbon intensity rating to the ship; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: if section 30(7) applies to the ship—that section has been complied with in respect of the ship. (L.N. 157 of 2022)

subsection.content: If the Director decides, on the basis of the consumption data and identification data reported under section 30C(2)(b), 30E(3)(b)(ii) or 30F(3)(b)(ii), or the attained annual operational CII reported under section 30H(2), in respect of a ship for a calendar year, to issue a Statement of Compliance in respect of the ship, the Director must issue the Statement by 31 May of the next calendar year. (L.N. 157 of 2022)

If the Director decides, on the basis of the consumption data and identification data reported under section 30D(2)(b), 30E(2)(b) or (3)(b)(i) or 30F(2)(b) or (3)(b)(i) in respect of a ship, to issue a Statement of Compliance in respect of the ship, the Director must issue the Statement as soon as practicable.

division.name: D3
division.heading: Withdrawal and Cancellation of Certificates etc.

subsection.content: A Government surveyor may, by written notice, require the owner or the master of a Hong Kong ship in respect of which a specified Certificate, an International Air Pollution Prevention Exemption Certificate for Unmanned Non-self-propelled (UNSP) Barges or an International Energy Efficiency Certificate has been issued to take such corrective action which the surveyor considers necessary if on a survey (other than an initial survey) of the ship under Part 5, the surveyor determines that the condition of the ship or its equipment does not correspond substantially with the particulars in the Certificate concerned. (L.N. 157 of 2022)
The surveyor must, on giving notice under subsection (1), inform the Director.

If the corrective action is not taken within the period specified by the surveyor, the surveyor must inform the Director and the Director may, by written notice to the owner and the master of the ship, withdraw the Certificate concerned.
On receiving a notice under subsection (3), the owner and the master of the ship must deliver the Certificate concerned to the Director immediately.
The owner or the master of the ship may, after the corrective action in respect of the ship has been taken, apply to the Director for the return of the Certificate concerned.

On receiving an application under subsection (5), if the Director is satisfied that the corrective action in respect of the ship has been taken, the Director must, by written notice to the owner or the master, return the Certificate concerned to the owner or the master.

subsection.leadIn: The Director may, by written notice to the owner and the master of a Hong Kong ship cancel any of the following issued in respect of the ship in the circumstances set out in subsection (2)— (L.N. 21 of 2019)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an International Air Pollution Prevention Certificate;

paragraph.name: ab
paragraph.content: an International Air Pollution Prevention Exemption Certificate for Unmanned Non-self-propelled (UNSP) Barges; (L.N. 157 of 2022)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a Hong Kong Air Pollution Prevention Certificate;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: an International Energy Efficiency Certificate;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: a Fuel Oil Consumption Reporting and Operational Carbon Intensity Compliance Statement. (L.N. 21 of 2019; L.N. 157 of 2022)

subsection.content: The circumstances are that the Director has reasonable grounds to believe that the Certificate or Statement concerned was issued, or any endorsement on the Certificate concerned was made, on the basis of false or erroneous information.
The Director must give reasons for cancelling the Certificate or Statement concerned in the notice under subsection (1).
On receiving a notice under subsection (1), the owner and the master of the ship must deliver the Certificate or Statement concerned to the Director immediately.

subsection.leadIn: If section 61(4) or 62(4) is contravened, the owner and the master of the ship concerned each commits an offence and is liable— (L.N. 21 of 2019)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on conviction on indictment to a fine at level 6; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on summary conviction to a fine at level 3.

subsection.content: It is a defence for a person charged under subsection (1) to show that the person had taken all reasonable steps to prevent the commission of the offence.

If an offence under subsection (1) is committed, or would, save for the operation of subsection (2), have been committed by the owner or the master of a ship due to the act or omission of some other person, that other person also commits the offence and may be charged with and convicted of the offence whether or not proceedings are taken against the owner or the master.

subsection.leadIn: Subject to the provisions of this Division and Division 5—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an International Air Pollution Prevention Certificate issued in respect of a ship as a result of an initial survey referred to in section 75 is valid for such period as may be specified by the Director in the Certificate;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a Hong Kong Air Pollution Prevention Certificate issued in respect of a ship as a result of an initial survey referred to in section 75 is valid for such period as may be specified by the Director in the Certificate; (L.N. 157 of 2022)

paragraph.name: ba
c
paragraph.content: an International Energy Efficiency Certificate issued in respect of a ship as a result of an initial survey referred to in section 81 is valid for the life of the ship.

subsection.content: The period specified by the Director in an International Air Pollution Prevention Certificate or a Hong Kong Air Pollution Prevention Certificate issued in respect of a ship must not exceed 5 years beginning on the date of completion of the initial survey of the ship.

subsection.name: 2A
subsection.content: The period specified in an International Air Pollution Prevention Exemption Certificate for Unmanned Non-self-propelled (UNSP) Barges issued on the basis of an initial survey or renewal survey in respect of a barge must not exceed 5 years beginning on the date of completion of the survey. (L.N. 157 of 2022)

For the purposes of this Division, a Hong Kong Air Pollution Prevention Certificate issued in respect of a ship is to be regarded as an International Air Pollution Prevention Certificate referred to in Regulation 9 of Annex VI.

section.name: s64A
section.heading: Duration of Fuel Oil Consumption Reporting and Operational Carbon Intensity Compliance Statement
section.leadIn: A Fuel Oil Consumption Reporting and Operational Carbon Intensity Compliance Statement issued in a calendar year has effect from the date of issue until— (L.N. 157 of 2022)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if it is issued in compliance with section 60A(4)—the expiry of 31 May of the next calendar year (second year); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if it is issued in compliance with section 60A(5)—the expiry of 31 May of the calendar year immediately after the second year.

section.name: s65
section.heading: Duration of specified Certificates issued after renewal surveys
section.content: A new specified Certificate issued in respect of a ship as a result of a renewal survey referred to in section 76 is valid for such period as may be specified by the Director in the Certificate in accordance with Regulation 9 of Annex VI.

section.name: s66
section.heading: Duration of specified Certificates after early completion of surveys

subsection.leadIn: This section applies if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an intermediate survey of a ship is completed before the period within which the survey is required under section 77 to be completed; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an annual survey of a ship is completed before the period within which the survey is required under section 78 to be completed.

subsection.content: For the purposes of sections 77 and 78, the anniversary date ascertained from the existing specified Certificate issued in respect of the ship is to be replaced by the anniversary date that is ascertained from the date shown on the endorsement made to the Certificate, and the date shown is to be a date within 3 months from the date of completion of the survey concerned.

Any subsequent intermediate or annual survey required by section 77 or 78 in respect of the ship is to be completed within the period provided under section 77 or 78 (as the case may be) by reference to the new anniversary date ascertained under subsection (2).
The duration of the existing specified Certificate issued in respect of the ship may be varied by the Director in accordance with Regulation 9 of Annex VI.

section.name: s67
section.heading: Extension of validity period of specified Certificates in certain circumstances
section.leadIn: The Director may extend the validity period of an existing specified Certificate issued in respect of a ship in accordance with Regulation 9 of Annex VI if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Certificate is valid for a period of less than 5 years;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the new specified Certificate cannot be issued or placed on board the ship before the expiry of the Certificate;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the ship is not in the port in which it is to be surveyed when the Certificate expires; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the ship is engaged in short voyages.

section.name: s68
section.heading: Specified Certificates cease to be valid
section.leadIn: A specified Certificate issued in respect of a Hong Kong ship ceases to be valid if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a survey referred to in Division 2 of Part 5 is not carried out in relation to the ship before the expiry of the period specified for the survey in that Division;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the Certificate is not endorsed under section 77 after an intermediate survey of the ship is carried out;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the Certificate is not endorsed under section 78 after an annual survey of the ship is carried out; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the ship is transferred to the registry of a place outside Hong Kong.

section.name: s68A
section.heading: When International Air Pollution Prevention Exemption Certificate for Unmanned Non-self-propelled (UNSP) Barges ceases to be valid
section.leadIn: An International Air Pollution Prevention Exemption Certificate for Unmanned Non-self-propelled (UNSP) Barges issued in respect of a UNSP barge (being a Hong Kong ship) ceases to be valid if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the barge is withdrawn from service and a notice to that effect has been given to the Director by the owner of the barge;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the barge is no longer a UNSP barge; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the barge ceases to be registered in Hong Kong.

section.name: s69
section.heading: International Energy Efficiency Certificates cease to be valid

subsection.leadIn: An International Energy Efficiency Certificate issued in respect of a Hong Kong ship ceases to be valid if— (L.N. 157 of 2022)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the ship is withdrawn from service and a notice to that effect has been given to the Director by the owner or the master of the ship;

paragraph.name: b
c
paragraph.content: the ship is transferred to the registry of a place outside Hong Kong; or (L.N. 157 of 2022)

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the ship’s equipment, systems, fittings, arrangements or material covered by the survey leading to the issue of the International Energy Efficiency Certificate is altered without the prior approval of the Director. (L.N. 157 of 2022)

subsection.content: Subsection (1)(d) does not apply if Regulation 3 of Annex VI applies in relation to the ship. (L.N. 157 of 2022)

division.name: D6
division.heading: Form, Alteration and Certified True Copies of Certificates etc.

section.name: s70
section.heading: Form of Certificates etc.
section.content: The Director may specify the form of a specified Certificate, an International Energy Efficiency Certificate, an International Air Pollution Prevention Exemption Certificate for Unmanned Non-self-propelled (UNSP) Barges or a Fuel Oil Consumption Reporting and Operational Carbon Intensity Compliance Statement.

subsection.content: The owner of a ship in respect of which an IAPP Certificate, an IAPPE Certificate, a HKAPP Certificate, an IEE Certificate or a Statement of Compliance has been issued may request the Director to alter any of the particulars contained in the Certificate or Statement. (L.N. 157 of 2022)
The Director may refuse to make the alteration if the Director considers it to be a material alteration.
If the Director agrees to make the alteration, the Director must, on payment of the prescribed fee, alter the Certificate or Statement.

section.name: s72
section.heading: Certified true copies of Certificates etc.

subsection.content: The owner of a ship in respect of which an IAPP Certificate, an IAPPE Certificate, a HKAPP Certificate, an IEE Certificate or a Statement of Compliance has been issued may apply to the Director for the issue of a certified true copy of the Certificate or Statement. (L.N. 21 of 2019; L.N. 157 of 2022)
The application must be accompanied by the prescribed fee for the certified true copy.

section.name: s73
section.heading: Certificates issued under repealed Regulation to be regarded as Certificates issued under this Regulation

subsection.content: An International Air Pollution Prevention Certificate issued under the repealed Regulation and in force immediately before the commencement# of this Regulation is to be regarded as an International Air Pollution Prevention Certificate issued under this Regulation.

A Hong Kong Air Pollution Prevention Certificate issued under the repealed Regulation and in force immediately before the commencement# of this Regulation is to be regarded as a Hong Kong Air Pollution Prevention Certificate issued under this Regulation.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: repealed Regulation (《已廢除規例》) means the Merchant Shipping (Prevention of Air Pollution) Regulation (Cap. 413 sub. leg. M) repealed by the Merchant Shipping (Prevention of Air Pollution) Regulation (Repeal) Regulation.

section.name: s74
section.heading: Application of this Part
section.content: This Part applies to a Hong Kong ship of 400 gross tonnage or above.

division.name: D2
division.heading: Surveys in relation to Specified Certificates

subsection.leadIn: An initial survey of a ship is to be carried out by a Government surveyor—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: before the ship is put into service; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: before a specified Certificate is issued for the first time in respect of the ship.

subsection.content: If, after having carried out an initial survey of the ship, the surveyor is satisfied that the equipment, systems, fittings, arrangements and material of the ship comply with the applicable requirements, the surveyor must make a declaration of survey to that effect and forward the declaration to the Director.

If the ship is installed with a regulated diesel engine to which Division 3 of Part 2, or Division 3 of Part 3, applies, the initial survey of the ship, in so far as it relates to the engine, is to be conducted in accordance with the NOx Technical Code.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: applicable requirements (適用規定) means—(a)in relation to an initial survey referred to in section 58, the requirements under Chapter 3 of Annex VI; and(b)in relation to an initial survey referred to in section 59, the requirements under Part 3.

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (2), a renewal survey of a ship is to be carried out by a Government surveyor within 5 years—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: from the date of completion of the initial survey of the ship; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if a renewal survey of the ship has been carried out, from the date of completion of the preceding renewal survey.

subsection.content: Where the validity of the specified Certificate issued in respect of the ship has been extended under section 67(c) or (d), the period of 5 years referred to in subsection (1) is to be extended by the period for which the Certificate is extended.

If, after having carried out a renewal survey of the ship, the surveyor is satisfied that the equipment, systems, fittings, arrangements and material of the ship comply with the applicable requirements, the surveyor must make a declaration of survey to that effect and forward the declaration to the Director.

If the ship is installed with a regulated diesel engine to which Division 3 of Part 2, or Division 3 of Part 3, applies, the renewal survey of the ship, in so far as it relates to the engine, is to be conducted in accordance with the NOx Technical Code.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: applicable requirements (適用規定) means—(a)in relation to a renewal survey referred to in section 58, the requirements under Chapter 3 of Annex VI; and(b)in relation to a renewal survey referred to in section 59, the requirements under Part 3.

subsection.leadIn: An intermediate survey of a ship is to be carried out by a Government surveyor—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: within the period commencing 3 months before and ending 3 months after the second anniversary date of the specified Certificate issued in respect of the ship; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: within the period commencing 3 months before and ending 3 months after the third anniversary date of the specified Certificate issued in respect of the ship.

subsection.leadIn: If, after having carried out an intermediate survey of the ship, the surveyor is satisfied that the equipment and arrangements of the ship—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: comply with the applicable requirements; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: are in good working order,

subsection.continued: the surveyor must make an endorsement to that effect on the Certificate.

subsection.content: If the ship is installed with a regulated diesel engine to which Division 3 of Part 2, or Division 3 of Part 3, applies, the intermediate survey of the ship, in so far as it relates to the engine, is to be conducted in accordance with the NOx Technical Code.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: applicable requirements (適用規定) means—(a)for a ship in respect of which an International Air Pollution Prevention Certificate is in force, the requirements under Chapter 3 of Annex VI; and(b)for a ship in respect of which a Hong Kong Air Pollution Prevention Certificate is in force, the requirements under Part 3.

subsection.content: Subject to subsection (2), an annual survey of a ship is to be carried out by a Government surveyor within the period commencing 3 months before and ending 3 months after each anniversary date of the specified Certificate issued in respect of the ship.

If an intermediate survey of the ship has been carried out under section 77 by reference to an anniversary date, the annual survey of the ship by reference to the anniversary date for the relevant year is not required to be carried out.
An annual survey of the ship must include a general inspection of the equipment, systems, fittings, arrangements and material of the ship.

subsection.leadIn: If, after having carried out an annual survey of the ship, the surveyor is satisfied that the equipment, systems, fittings, arrangements and material of the ship—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: have been maintained in accordance with the applicable requirements; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: remain satisfactory for the service for which the ship is intended,

subsection.continued: the surveyor must make an endorsement to that effect on the Certificate.

subsection.content: If the ship is installed with a regulated diesel engine to which Division 3 of Part 2, or Division 3 of Part 3, applies, the annual survey of the ship, in so far as it relates to the engine, is to be conducted in accordance with the NOx Technical Code.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: applicable requirements (適用規定) means—(a)for a ship in respect of which an International Air Pollution Prevention Certificate is in force, the requirements under Chapter 3 of Annex VI; and(b)for a ship in respect of which a Hong Kong Air Pollution Prevention Certificate is in force, the requirements under Part 3.

subsection.content: The Director may, by written notice to the owner and the master of a ship, require an additional survey of the ship to be carried out by a Government surveyor within a reasonable period specified by the Director.

subsection.leadIn: The Director may only exercise the power under subsection (1) if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: after a specified Certificate has been issued in respect of the ship, alterations have been made to the equipment, systems, fittings, arrangements or material covered by the survey leading to the issue of the Certificate;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the Director has reasonable grounds to believe that important repairs or renewals have been made to the ship after a specified Certificate has been issued;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the Director has reasonable grounds to believe that section 83 is not complied with in respect of the ship; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the Director determines on the basis of an investigation under section 86 that the survey is necessary.

subsection.content: On receiving a notice under subsection (1), the owner and the master of the ship must cause an additional survey to be carried out.
The additional survey may be general or partial as the Director thinks fit.

subsection.leadIn: If, after having carried out an additional survey of the ship, the surveyor is satisfied that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the equipment, systems, fittings, arrangements and material of the ship which are the subject matter of the survey comply with the applicable requirements; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: where repairs or renewals have been made to the ship—

subparagraph.content: such repairs or renewals have been effectively made; and
the materials used in, and the workmanship of, such repairs or renewals are satisfactory,

subsection.continued: the surveyor must make a declaration of survey to that effect and forward the declaration to the Director.

subsection.content: If the ship is installed with a regulated diesel engine to which Division 3 of Part 2, or Division 3 of Part 3, applies, the additional survey of the ship, in so far as it relates to the engine, is to be conducted in accordance with the NOx Technical Code.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: applicable reqirements (適用規定) means—(a)for a ship in respect of which an International Air Pollution Prevention Certificate is in force, the requirements under Chapter 3 of Annex VI; and(b)for a ship in respect of which a Hong Kong Air Pollution Prevention Certificate is in force, the requirements under Part 3.

subsection.leadIn: If section 79(3) is contravened, the owner and the master of the ship concerned each commits an offence and is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on conviction on indictment to a fine at level 6; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on summary conviction to a fine at level 3.

subsection.content: It is a defence for a person charged under subsection (1) to show that the person had taken all reasonable steps to prevent the commission of the offence.

If an offence under subsection (1) is committed, or would, save for the operation of subsection (2), have been committed by the owner or the master of a ship due to the act or omission of some other person, that other person also commits the offence and may be charged with and convicted of the offence whether or not proceedings are taken against the owner or the master.

division.name: D2A
division.heading: Surveys in relation to IAPPE Certificates

subsection.content: An initial survey or renewal survey of a barge for the purposes of section 58A(3) is to be carried out by a Government surveyor.
The owner of the barge must provide the Government surveyor with the information and drawings in respect of the barge requested by the surveyor for the survey.

subsection.leadIn: If, after having carried out an initial survey or renewal survey of the barge, the Government surveyor is satisfied that the barge is a UNSP barge, the surveyor must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: make a declaration of survey to that effect; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: forward the declaration to the Director.

subsection.content: The Director may, by written notice to the owner of a barge in respect of which an International Air Pollution Prevention Exemption Certificate for Unmanned Non-self-propelled (UNSP) Barges is issued, require an additional survey of the barge to be carried out by a Government surveyor within a reasonable period specified in the notice.
The additional survey may be general or partial as the Director thinks fit.
The Director may exercise the power under subsection (1) only if the Director has reasonable grounds to believe that the barge is no longer a UNSP barge.
On receiving a notice under subsection (1), the owner of the barge must cause an additional survey to be carried out.
The owner of the barge must provide the Government surveyor with the information and drawings in respect of the barge requested by the surveyor for the survey. (E.R. 6 of 2022)

subsection.leadIn: If, after having carried out an additional survey of the barge, the Government surveyor is satisfied that the barge is a UNSP barge, the surveyor must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: make a declaration of survey to that effect; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: forward the declaration to the Director.

division.name: D3
division.heading: Surveys in relation to IEE Certificates

subsection.leadIn: An initial survey of a ship is to be carried out by a Government surveyor—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: before the ship is put into service;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: before an International Energy Efficiency Certificate is issued for the first time in respect of the ship; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: where, after the ship has undergone a major modification, the Director directs that an initial survey of the ship is to be carried out.

subsection.content: If, after having carried out an initial survey of the ship, the surveyor is satisfied as to the matters referred to in subsection (3), the surveyor must make a declaration of survey to that effect and forward the declaration to the Director.

subsection.leadIn: The matters are—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in relation to an existing ship (other than a modified existing ship) or a special ship, that the Ship Energy Efficiency Management Plan required by section 30 to be kept on board the ship (SEEM Plan) is placed on board the ship; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: in relation to any other ship—

subparagraph.content: (where the ship belongs to one of the categories of ship referred to in Regulation 22 of Annex VI) that an Attained EEDI has been calculated for the ship; (L.N. 157 of 2022)

(where the ship belongs to a type of ship the reference line values and the reduction factors of which are set out in Annex VI) that the Attained EEDI of the ship is less than or equals to the Required EEDI of the ship calculated according to the reference line values and the reduction factors that are applicable to the ship as specified in Annex VI;

subparagraph.name: 2aa
subparagraph.content: (if the ship belongs to one of the categories of ship referred to in Regulation 23 of Annex VI) that an attained EEXI has been calculated for the ship; (L.N. 157 of 2022)

subparagraph.name: 2aab
subparagraph.content: (if the initial survey is carried out on or after 1 January 2023 and the ship belongs to a type of ship the reference line values and the reduction factors of which are set out in Annex VI) that the attained EEXI of the ship is less than or equals to the required EEXI of the ship calculated according to the reference line values and the reduction factors that are applicable to the ship as specified in Annex VI; (L.N. 157 of 2022)

subparagraph.name: 2a
subparagraph.content: (if the ship is of 5 000 gross tonnage or above and has undergone a major modification that affects the data collection methodology or reporting process of the ship) that the SEEM Plan required to be kept on board the ship has been revised appropriately to reflect the modification; (L.N. 21 of 2019; L.N. 157 of 2022)
that the SEEM Plan is placed on board the ship; and (L.N. 157 of 2022)

(if the ship is of 5 000 gross tonnage or above and belongs to one of the categories of ship referred to in Regulation 26.3 of Annex VI) that the SEEM Plan includes the information set out in Regulation 26.3.1 of Annex VI. (L.N. 157 of 2022)

subsection.leadIn: An additional survey of a new ship (other than a special ship) is to be carried out by a Government surveyor if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the ship has undergone a major modification; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the Director directs that an additional survey of the ship is to be carried out.

subsection.content: If, after having carried out an additional survey of the ship, the surveyor is satisfied as to the matters referred to in subsection (3), the surveyor must make a declaration of survey to that effect and forward the declaration to the Director.

subsection.leadIn: The matters are—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: (where the ship belongs to one of the categories of ship referred to in Regulation 22 of Annex VI) that an Attained EEDI has been calculated for the ship; (L.N. 157 of 2022)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: (where the ship belongs to a type of ship the reference line values and the reduction factors of which are set out in Annex VI) that the Attained EEDI of the ship is less than or equals to the Required EEDI of the ship calculated according to the reference line values and the reduction factors that are applicable to the ship as specified in Annex VI;

paragraph.name: baa
paragraph.content: (if the ship belongs to one of the categories of ship referred to in Regulation 23 of Annex VI) that an attained EEXI has been calculated for the ship; (L.N. 157 of 2022)

paragraph.name: baab
paragraph.content: (if the additional survey is carried out on or after 1 January 2023 and the ship belongs to a type of ship the reference line values and the reduction factors of which are set out in Annex VI) that the attained EEXI of the ship is less than or equals to the required EEXI of the ship calculated according to the reference line values and the reduction factors that are applicable to the ship as specified in Annex VI; (L.N. 157 of 2022)

paragraph.name: ba
paragraph.content: (if the ship is of 5 000 gross tonnage or above and the major modification affects the data collection methodology or reporting process of the ship) that the Ship Energy Efficiency Management Plan required by section 30 to be kept on board the ship (SEEM Plan) has been revised appropriately to reflect the modification; (L.N. 21 of 2019; L.N. 157 of 2022)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: that the SEEM Plan is placed on board the ship; and (L.N. 157 of 2022)

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: (if the ship is of 5 000 gross tonnage or above and belongs to one of the categories of ship referred to in Regulation 26.3 of Annex VI) that the SEEM Plan includes the information set out in Regulation 26.3.1 of Annex VI. (L.N. 157 of 2022)

subsection.content: The additional survey may either be general or partial as the Director thinks fit.

section.name: s83
section.heading: Duty to maintain condition of ships

subsection.content: The owner and the master of a ship to which Part 2 applies must maintain the condition of the ship and of its equipment so as to comply with the requirements under Chapters 3 and 4 of Annex VI to ensure that the ship remains fit to proceed to sea without presenting any unreasonable threat of harm to the marine environment.

The owner and the master of a ship to which Part 3 applies must maintain the condition of the ship and of its equipment so as to comply with the requirements under Part 3 to ensure that the ship remains fit to proceed to sea without presenting any unreasonable threat of harm to the marine environment.

section.name: s84
section.heading: Certain alterations subject to approval of Director
section.content: The owner and the master of a Hong Kong ship of 400 gross tonnage or above must obtain the prior approval of the Director if any alteration is to be made to the equipment, systems, fittings, arrangements or material of the ship which are covered by the survey leading to the issue or endorsement of a specified Certificate.

section.name: s85
section.heading: Certificates etc. to be kept on board

subsection.leadIn: The owner and the master of a ship of 400 gross tonnage or above (other than a non-Chapter 4 ship) engaged in an international voyage must keep on board the ship the following certificates or documents issued in respect of the ship which are for the time being in force, and make them available for inspection by a Government surveyor at all reasonable times—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an International Air Pollution Prevention Certificate, or a certificate or document issued by or under the authority of an Administration certifying or confirming that the ship is in compliance with Chapter 3 of Annex VI; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if section 5(1)(b) applies to the ship, an International Energy Efficiency Certificate, or a certificate or document issued by or under the authority of an Administration certifying or confirming that the ship is in compliance with Chapter 4 of Annex VI.

subsection.leadIn: The owner and the master of a non-Chapter 4 ship of 400 gross tonnage or above engaged in an international voyage must keep on board the ship the following certificate or document issued in respect of the ship which is for the time being in force, and make it available for inspection by a Government surveyor at all reasonable times—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an International Air Pollution Prevention Certificate; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a certificate or document issued by or under the authority of an Administration certifying or confirming that the ship is in compliance with Chapter 3 of Annex VI.

subsection.leadIn: The owner and the master of a ship of 400 gross tonnage or above (other than a ship that is not self-propelled) engaged in a non-international voyage must keep on board the ship the following certificate or document issued in respect of the ship which is for the time being in force, and make it available for inspection by a Government surveyor at all reasonable times—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an International Air Pollution Prevention Certificate or a Hong Kong Air Pollution Prevention Certificate; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a certificate or document issued by or under the authority of an Administration the effect of which is recognized by the Director as equivalent to that of an International Air Pollution Prevention Certificate or a Hong Kong Air Pollution Prevention Certificate.

subsection.leadIn: The owner and the master of a ship of 5 000 gross tonnage or above (other than a non-Chapter 4 ship) engaged in an international voyage must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: keep on board the ship all Fuel Oil Consumption Reporting and Operational Carbon Intensity Compliance Statements that are issued in respect of the ship within the past 5 years; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: make the Statements available for inspection by a Government surveyor at all reasonable times. (L.N. 21 of 2019; L.N. 157 of 2022)

section.name: s85A
section.heading: Certificate for UNSP barges to be kept on towing and pushing vessels

subsection.content: This section applies to a UNSP barge that is engaged in a towing or pushing operation during an international voyage.

subsection.leadIn: The following certificate in force in respect of the UNSP barge must be made available to the towing or pushing vessel during the towing or pushing operation—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if the barge is exempted under section 6(3)—the International Air Pollution Prevention Exemption Certificate for Unmanned Non-self-propelled (UNSP) Barges; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: otherwise—the International Air Pollution Prevention Certificate.

subsection.content: During the towing or pushing operation, the certificate mentioned in subsection (2)(a) or (b) must be kept on board the towing or pushing vessel.

section.name: s86
section.heading: Duty to report accidents or defects

subsection.content: If an accident occurs to, or a defect is discovered in, a ship, and the accident or defect substantially affects the efficiency or completeness of the equipment or systems of the ship, the owner and the master of the ship must report the accident or defect to the Authority.
The Director may, on receiving a report under subsection (1), cause an investigation to be initiated.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: Authority (主管當局) means—(a)if the ship is within the waters of Hong Kong, the Director; or(b)if the ship is a Hong Kong ship that is in a port of any Convention country outside Hong Kong, the Director and the appropriate authority of that country.

section.name: s87
section.heading: Duty to keep bunker delivery note and representative sample of fuel oil

subsection.leadIn: The owner and the master of a ship of 400 gross tonnage or above must, on completion of a bunkering operation of fuel oil— (L.N. 105 of 2025)

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.leadIn: keep the bunker delivery note on board the ship in a place so as to be readily available for inspection at all reasonable times—

subparagraph.content: for a ship engaged in international voyages, until the expiry of the period of 3 years after the day on which the fuel oil is delivered to the ship; and
for a ship engaged in non-international voyages, until the expiry of the period of 6 months after the day on which the fuel oil is delivered to the ship; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: for a ship engaged in an international voyage, retain the representative sample of the fuel oil that accompanies the bunker delivery note until—

subparagraph.content: the fuel oil is substantially consumed; or
the expiry of the period of 12 months beginning on the day on which the fuel oil is delivered to the ship,

subsection.leadIn: Subsection (1) does not apply to a ship which uses—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: coal in solid form; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: nuclear fuels.

subsection.leadIn: Subsection (1)(a) and (c) does not apply to a ship that uses—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: low-flashpoint fuels; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: gas fuels. (L.N. 105 of 2025)

section.name: s88
section.heading: Duties of local supplier of fuel oil

subsection.leadIn: A local supplier must, in respect of any fuel oil delivered by the supplier to be used on board a ship of 400 gross tonnage or above— (L.N. 105 of 2025)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: prepare a bunker delivery note that contains—

subparagraph.content: if the fuel oil delivered is low-flashpoint fuel or gas fuel—the information referred to in Regulation 18.5 of Annex VI that is to be provided in accordance with that Regulation; or
if the fuel oil delivered is neither low-flashpoint fuel nor gas fuel—the information referred to in Regulation 18.5 of Annex VI; (L.N. 105 of 2025)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: sign and certify a declaration in the bunker delivery note to confirm that the fuel oil delivered complies with the requirements on the quality of fuel oil set out in Regulations 14 and 18 of Annex VI;

paragraph.name: c
d
paragraph.content: deliver to the officer in charge of the bunkering operation or the master of the ship the bunker delivery note and, if the fuel oil delivered is neither low-flashpoint fuel nor gas fuel, the representative sample of the fuel oil delivered; (L.N. 105 of 2025)

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: keep a copy of the bunker delivery note for a period of 3 years after the day on which the fuel oil is delivered to the ship; and

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: make the copy kept under paragraph (e) available for inspection at all reasonable times.

subsection.content: A local supplier must, in respect of gas fuels delivered by the supplier to be used on board a ship of 400 gross tonnage or above for combustion purpose, make a record of the sulphur content of the gas fuels.

subsection.leadIn: This section does not apply to a ship which uses—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: coal in solid form; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: nuclear fuels.

subsection.leadIn: Subsection (1)(c) does not apply to a ship that uses—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: low-flashpoint fuels; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: gas fuels. (L.N. 105 of 2025)

subsection.content: If any of the requirements in section 83(1) or (2), 84, 85(1), (2), (3) or (4), 86(1) or 87(1) is contravened in respect of a ship, the owner and the master of the ship each commits an offence. (L.N. 21 of 2019)

subsection.name: 1A
subsection.content: If the requirement in section 85A(2) is contravened in respect of a UNSP barge, the owner and the operator of the barge each commits an offence. (L.N. 157 of 2022)

subsection.name: 1B
subsection.content: If the requirement in section 85A(3) is contravened in respect of a towing or pushing vessel, the owner and the master of the vessel each commits an offence. (L.N. 157 of 2022)
If any of the requirements in section 88(1) or (2) is contravened, the local supplier concerned commits an offence.

subsection.leadIn: A person who commits an offence under this section is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on conviction on indictment to a fine at level 6; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on summary conviction to a fine at level 3.

subsection.content: It is a defence for a person charged under this section to show that the person had taken all reasonable steps to prevent the commission of the offence.

If an offence under this section is committed, or would, save for the operation of subsection (4), have been committed by the owner, the master or the operator of a ship due to the act or omission of some other person, that other person also commits the offence and may be charged with and convicted of the offence whether or not proceedings are taken against the owner, the master or the operator. (L.N. 157 of 2022)

section.name: s90
section.heading: Power to inspect bunker delivery notes, etc.

subsection.leadIn: A Government surveyor may, for controlling the quality of fuel oil that is supplied to a ship to which this section applies—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: require the owner or master of the ship to— (L.N. 153 of 2021)

subparagraph.content: provide for inspection any bunker delivery note of the fuel oil required to be kept under section 87; and
provide for examination any representative sample of the fuel oil required to be retained under section 87; (L.N. 153 of 2021)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: require the local supplier who supplied the fuel oil to the ship to provide for inspection a copy of the bunker delivery note required to be kept under section 88;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: make a copy of the bunker delivery note referred to in paragraph (a) or (b); or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: require the master, any other officer in charge of the ship or the local supplier to certify that the copy made under paragraph (c) is a true copy of the bunker delivery note.

subsection.content: This section applies to a ship of 400 gross tonnage or above which is within the waters of Hong Kong.

section.name: s91
section.heading: Power of Government surveyors to inspect, examine etc. ships

subsection.content: Any of the powers conferred by this section may be exercised for the purpose of ascertaining whether this Regulation has been or is being complied with.

subsection.leadIn: A Government surveyor may, at any reasonable time—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: board a ship that is within the waters of Hong Kong; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: take with the surveyor any other person and any equipment or materials required to assist the surveyor.

subsection.leadIn: After boarding the ship, the surveyor may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: inspect the ship;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: make any examination and investigation as the surveyor considers necessary;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: take samples of any article or substance found on the ship that the surveyor may reasonably require for the inspection, examination or investigation;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: inspect, seize and remove from the ship any article or substance in respect of which the surveyor suspects on reasonable grounds that an offence under this Regulation has been committed;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.leadIn: detain the article or substance for so long as is necessary—

subparagraph.content: for the inspection, examination or investigation; and
to ensure that it is available for use as evidence in any proceedings for an offence under this Regulation;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: take any measurements and photographs and make any recordings that the surveyor may reasonably require for the inspection, examination or investigation;

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: require that the ship or any part of it, or anything on the ship, is to be left undisturbed (whether generally or in particular respects) for so long as is necessary for the inspection, examination or investigation;

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.leadIn: require any person who the surveyor reasonably believes is able to give any information relevant to the inspection, examination or investigation—

subparagraph.content: to attend at a place and time specified by the surveyor;
to answer the questions that the surveyor thinks fit to ask; and
to sign a declaration of the truth of the person’s answers;

paragraph.leadIn: require the production of, and inspect and take copies of or of any entry in—

subparagraph.content: any certificates, books or documents that are required to be kept under this Regulation; and
any other certificates, books or documents that the surveyor considers necessary for the inspection, examination or investigation; and

paragraph.name: j
paragraph.content: require any person to afford the surveyor such facilities and assistance with respect to any matters or things within that person’s control or in relation to which that person has responsibilities as the surveyor considers necessary to enable the surveyor to exercise any power conferred by this section.

subsection.content: If an inspection of a ship under subsection (3) reveals a deficiency, the Director may give a direction to the master of the ship requiring the master to cause the ship not to proceed to sea until the deficiency is rectified.

subsection.leadIn: A master to whom a direction is given under subsection (4) must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: comply with the direction;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: take steps to rectify the deficiency; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: inform the Director once the deficiency is rectified.

subsection.content: If the ship concerned is a Hong Kong ship and the deficiency is not rectified within the period specified by the Director, the Director may, by written notice to the owner and the master of the ship, withdraw the International Air Pollution Prevention Certificate, the Hong Kong Air Pollution Prevention Certificate or the International Energy Efficiency Certificate issued in respect of the ship.
On receiving a notice under subsection (6), the owner and the master of the ship must deliver the Certificate concerned to the Director immediately.
The owner or the master of the ship may, after the deficiency in respect of the ship has been rectified, apply to the Director for the return of the Certificate concerned.

On receiving an application under subsection (8), if the Director is satisfied that the deficiency in respect of the ship has been rectified, the Director must, by written notice to the owner or the master, return the Certificate concerned to the owner or the master.

subsection.leadIn: A person must not—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: wilfully obstruct a Government surveyor in the exercise of any power conferred by section 90 or 91; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: make a statement or sign a declaration that the person knows is false, or recklessly make a statement or sign a declaration that is false, in purported compliance with a requirement under section 91(3)(h).

subsection.content: A person must comply with a requirement imposed on the person under section 91(3).

subsection.leadIn: If section 91(7) is contravened, the owner and the master of the ship concerned each commits an offence and is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on conviction on indictment to a fine at level 6; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on summary conviction to a fine at level 3.

subsection.content: A person who contravenes section 92(1) commits an offence and is liable to a fine at level 6.
A person who fails to comply with section 92(2) commits an offence and is liable to a fine at level 6.
It is a defence for a person charged under subsection (1) to show that the person had taken all reasonable steps to prevent the commission of the offence.

If an offence under this section is committed, or would, save for the operation of subsection (4), have been committed by the owner or the master of a ship due to the act or omission of some other person, that other person also commits the offence and may be charged with and convicted of the offence whether or not proceedings are taken against the owner or the master.

section.name: s94
section.heading: Director may appoint Government surveyors
section.content: The Director may appoint a person to be a Government surveyor for the purposes of this Regulation.

section.name: s95
section.heading: Director may recognize organizations to survey ships and issue certificates etc.
section.leadIn: The Director may recognize an organization for—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: carrying out surveys of Hong Kong ships in conformity with Part 5;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: issuing any of the following in respect of Hong Kong ships in conformity with Part 4— (L.N. 21 of 2019)

subparagraph.content: International Air Pollution Prevention Certificates;

subparagraph.name: 1a
subparagraph.content: International Air Pollution Prevention Exemption Certificates for Unmanned Non-self-propelled (UNSP) Barges; (L.N. 157 of 2022)
Hong Kong Air Pollution Prevention Certificates;
International Energy Efficiency Certificates;
Fuel Oil Consumption Reporting and Operational Carbon Intensity Compliance Statements; (L.N. 21 of 2019; L.N. 157 of 2022)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: making endorsements on the Certificates referred to in paragraph (b)(i), (iii) and (iv) that are issued by the organization in conformity with Part 5; (L.N. 73 of 2020)

paragraph.name: ca
paragraph.content: making endorsements on Hong Kong Air Pollution Prevention Certificates in conformity with Part 5; (L.N. 73 of 2020)

paragraph.name: d
e
paragraph.content: altering any particulars contained in the Certificates or Statements referred to in paragraph (b) that are issued by the organization;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: issuing certified true copies of the Certificates or Statements referred to in paragraph (b) that are issued by the organization;

paragraph.name: g
ga
paragraph.content: verifying or reviewing Ship Energy Efficiency Management Plans, or issuing confirmations or conducting company audits in relation to Ship Energy Efficiency Management Plans, for the purposes of section 30; (L.N. 157 of 2022)

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.content: receiving consumption data and identification data of Hong Kong ships reported under Division 9A of Part 2; (L.N. 21 of 2019; L.N. 157 of 2022)
verifying the reported data mentioned in paragraph (h); and (L.N. 21 of 2019; L.N. 157 of 2022)

paragraph.name: j
paragraph.content: approving Volatile Organic Compounds Management Plans in respect of tankers. (L.N. 157 of 2022)

section.name: s96
section.heading: Director may request Convention countries to survey Hong Kong ships and issue or endorse certificates
section.leadIn: The Director may request any Convention country—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to carry out a survey in respect of a Hong Kong ship of 400 gross tonnage or above on behalf of the Director in conformity with Annex VI; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: to do the following—

subparagraph.content: issue an International Air Pollution Prevention Certificate or an International Energy Efficiency Certificate in respect of the ship in conformity with Annex VI; or
endorse on an International Air Pollution Prevention Certificate or an International Energy Efficiency Certificate issued in respect of the ship in conformity with Annex VI.

section.name: s97
section.heading: Director may at request of Convention countries survey non-Hong Kong ships and issue or endorse certificates

subsection.leadIn: The Director may, at the request of any Convention country— (L.N. 157 of 2022)

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.leadIn: do the following—

subparagraph.content: issue an IAPP Certificate or an IEE Certificate in respect of the ship under Part 4 as if the ship were a Hong Kong ship; or
endorse on an International Air Pollution Prevention Certificate or an International Energy Efficiency Certificate issued in respect of the ship in conformity with Annex VI.

subsection.content: However, no certificate may be issued under subsection (1)(b)(i) in respect of a non-Hong Kong ship entitled to fly the flag of a country that is not a Convention country. (L.N. 157 of 2022)

section.name: s98
section.heading: Director may accept equivalents
section.leadIn: The Director may allow any fitting, material, appliance or apparatus to be fitted in a ship or any procedures, alternative fuel oils, or compliance methods to be used for complying with—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in relation to a ship to which Part 2 applies, Chapter 3 of Annex VI; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in relation to a ship to which Part 3 applies, Part 3.

section.name: s99
section.heading: Director may grant exemption
section.content: The Director may exempt any ship or class or description of ships from any of the requirements of this Regulation on such conditions as the Director may specify, and the Director may alter or cancel any such exemption.

section.name: s100
section.heading: Access to Annex VI and NOx Technical Code

subsection.content: The Director must keep a copy of the English and Chinese texts of Annex VI and the NOx Technical Code at the office of the Director.
The Director must allow the public to inspect the texts free of charge at the office during normal office hours.
